title: Senior Software Engineer
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer with strong skills in cloud-native backend development and a passion for building secure, high-performance healthcare software. In this role, you’ll design and develop backend services, lead architectural discussions, and mentor engineers—working closely with frontend, QA, and product teams to deliver integrated solutions.
   

  

 Our current focus is on Golang, React, Kubernetes, and Azure, but experience with C++, embedded systems, and medical interoperability ( SDPi /SDC) is highly valuable for both current and future needs in our team.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack**
 Here’s a look at the tools and technologies you’ll be working with:
   

  

* Languages & Frameworks: Go (Golang), TypeScript, JavaScript, React, Java , Bash
* Interoperability & Standards: SDPi , SDC (IEEE 11073), HL7-FHIR, MQTT
* Cloud Platform : Microsoft Azure (AKS, Event Grid)
* Containers & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes
* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Helm, Ansible
* CI/CD: GitLab CI
* Monitoring & Logging: Prometheus, Grafana
* Version Control: GitLab


 We’re constantly evolving our stack to meet new challenges—your input will directly shape our future architecture.
   

  

 Other h ighly valuable skills: C++, embedded systems, SDPi /SDC (IEEE 11073), HL7-FHIR, MQTT, IEC 62304, ISO 13485.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and build backend services in Go, ensuring scalability, security, and regulatory compliance.
* Shape our Azure-based architecture, leveraging Kubernetes, containers, and modern DevOps practices.
* Champion CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and compliance (e.g., IEC 62304), while ensuring secure, traceable, and maintainable code.
* Collaborate across teams to deliver integrated cloud and frontend solutions.
* Mentor and guide developers, fostering best practices in coding, testing, and deployment.
* Contribute expertise in C++, embedded systems, and medical interoperability where applicable.


**You’ll bring**
* Proven experience with Golang and Azure in production systems.
* Solid knowledge of Kubernetes, CI/CD, and infrastructure automation.
* Ability to work effectively across backend, frontend, and infrastructure teams.
* Bonus: C++, embedded development, and medical interoperability expertise.


**Why join Getinge**
 You’ll work on cutting-edge medical software that spans embedded firmware, cloud-native infrastructure, and device interoperability. This is a high-impact role where your decisions will shape our platform architecture and directly influence real-world clinical outcomes. We offer an environment that values technical ownership, innovation, and cross-functional learning, with opportunities to grow into broader leadership roles in a growing team.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible, but no later than 25.09.01. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Ayodeji Ayibiowu  at ayodeji.ayibiowu@getinge.com or Recruiter Frida Svensson at Frida.svensson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.
   

  

 Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Growth Client Manager (DACH)
description:
**About the Job** 




  





 At Proxify, you will be connected with inbound early-stage startups. These companies usually want to take their first steps in building their tech organization. Your goal is to help them build the right technical foundation and assemble a strong team to make this company take its first step toward becoming a unicorn.
 



  





 When the deal is closed, you will nurture a strong client relationship and make sure they partner with Proxify for years.
 



  





**About Proxify** 




  





 Proxify is a leading global network of top-tier, vetted remote software, data, and AI professionals, designed to help businesses rapidly scale their tech teams with world-class talent, delivering the perfect match within two days on average. Only 1% of applicants, from over 20,000 applications each month, are accepted into the network to ensure unmatched quality. Our service offers the speed, quality, and flexibility that innovative companies demand, with true technical experts to assist at each step enabling you to seamlessly augment your existing team or build a new one without the administrative burden and risk of traditional employment.
 



  





**Are you a true relationship builder with a strong understanding of technology, people, and business?** 




  





 We're on the lookout for a tech-savvy and high-performing Growth Client Manager with a strong tech background and interest to play a pivotal client facing role in our rapid expansion in DACH.
 



 As part of the Client Management & Commercial team, you’ll be responsible for matching early-stage clients with exceptional developer talent, driving success for both Proxify and its clients. As a key member of the DACH team, you'll focus on the DACH market where the demand for skilled developers is exploding.
 



  





**Why you’ll love this opportunity at Proxify:** 




  





 🌐 Solve most tech teams’ biggest challenge - bridging their competence gap - and at the same time offer great opportunities to developers globally
 



 ❤️ Join a team of tech lovers where support and humility are our guiding principles
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships in DACH
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international environment where we occasionally meet and spend quality time together (our team spans 39 countries!).
 



  





**To be successful in this role, we believe that you:** 




  





 - Count with the required advanced level of English and (ideally) German;
 



 - Have hands-on experience with technology, such as working as a technical project manager, product manager, developer, or a similar role, ideally within a tech team;
 



 - Take ownership with urgency, supporting MVPs to ensure focus and efficiency;
 



 - Understand how to help a client and guiding them through the customer journey;
 



 - Naturally sociable and curious – effortlessly engaging and easy to connect with in conversation!
 



  





**Why it may not be your match:** 




  





 ❌ You like every day to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep things agile
 



 ❌ You don’t have technical experience
 



  





**Compensation** 
 :
 



  





 Reference base of 35,000 SEK that could be adjusted based on seniority.

title: React Native App Developer
company_industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos, Technology, Information and Media, and Internet Marketplace Platforms
description:
**WHO WE ARE:** 




  





 Glitnor Group was founded by industry veterans with a wealth of experience in founding and managing numerous successful businesses over the past decade. We have a global presence with a unique and proven track record of building and nurturing strong brands, culture & work environment. Our vision is to take global leadership and change the competitive landscape for Game Studios, Game Operators and Lead Generation.
 



  





 Glitnor has enjoyed rapid growth since its foundation in 2018, and now has over 200 team members representing more than 20 nationalities. The company has physical locations in Sweden, Malta, Bulgaria, Spain and Gibraltar, and also a number of remote team members around the world.
 



  





 We are built on the core belief that work should be a source of positivity. We foster an environment where freedom is coupled with responsibility, empowering individuals to harness their talents and drive professional advancement. We believe in promoting internally where possible, encouraging team members to reach the pinnacle of their ability.
 



  





  





**We are looking for a Native App Developer to join our growing team.** 




  





  





 As a Native App Developer at Glitnor, you will join our talented Native team, which drives the development of our world-class native app offerings. The team is dedicated to creating cutting-edge mobile applications, delivering native optimizations, and enhancing the user experience for our customers. If you’re passionate about mobile app development, especially within the Android ecosystem, and want to contribute to a dynamic, fast-paced environment, this is the role for you.
 



  





  





**What will you be doing?** 




  




* Develop and enhance our native mobile applications, delivering optimizations and features that stand out in the competitive gaming market.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure technical excellence and an outstanding user experience.
* Take ownership of product goals, from planning to implementation and delivery.
* Stay up-to-date with the Android ecosystem and industry best practices to ensure our apps remain cutting-edge.
* Manage the release processes for both iOS and Android, including app signing, provisioning profiles, App Store and Google Play submission, and builds using tools like Fastlane or CI/CD pipelines.



  





  





**What we use** 




  




* Development: React Native, TypeScript
* Testing & Tools: Jest, React Testing Library
* Delivery: Continuous Delivery practices for seamless releases



  





  





**Who are you?** 




  




* 3+ years of experience in mobile app development, with strong expertise in React Native.
* Proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript with a focus on building scalable, high-quality applications.
* Experienced with release processes for both iOS and Android, including app signing, provisioning profiles, and app submissions to the App Store and Google Play.
* Familiar with tools like Fastlane and CI/CD pipelines for managing builds and deployments.
* Passionate about usability and graphical design with a keen eye for detail.
* A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment, taking full ownership of your work.
* A collaborative team player who values teamwork but can also work independently with a strong work ethic.
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal.



  





  





**What will make you stand out?** 




  




* Familiarity with Next.js or other front-end frameworks.
* Experience with page and image optimization techniques.
* Background in iGaming or other similar industries.



  





  





 By joining us, you're not only gaining an opportunity to work and collaborate with the best talent in our industry, you’ll also enjoy a range of fantastic perks!
 


* A competitive and attractive salary
* Private health insurance
* Annual wellbeing benefit allowance
* A weekly breakfast
* Social events for building strong relationships with colleagues



  





  





**At Glitnor we firmly believe that our diversity is what makes us unique and that everyone is welcome to enjoy the ride! We are committed to uphold a high level of diversity and inclusion throughout our group.**

title: JavaScript+Node Developer
description:
**Would you like to deal with climate changes during your daily work?**
 Vattenfall is looking for Fullstack Developer to support our Asset IT team. As a team member you will work on contributing to our vision with fossil free living within one generation.
   

  

**What do we do?**
 As a team we are responsible for full software lifecycle. We work in Scrum and we develop distributed, clean, quality software with automated test suite, that we run in cloud environment.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Build & maintain JavaScript/TypeScript code (write clear, maintainable code)
* Build & maintain business specific application logic within Node APIs
* Work with portals, mobile apps or PWA
* Work with Azure Services
* Release software to Azure PaaS (via Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines)
* Ensure product stability & security


**Location**
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Company Description**
 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.
   

  

**Qualifications**
**Who are you?**
**As Our Fullstack Developer You Have**
* solid experience in NodeJS (Express), MS SQL (TypeORM)
* experience in working with React Framework
* ability to Write and maintain code using TypeScript
* Redux practical experience
* some experience with Cloud Services
* ability to estimate tasks and keep on promises
* quality focused mindset
* communicative English (used on a daily basis)


**Next To This You Bring As An Advantage**
* hands-on experience in Azure Cloud PaaS components (creating, monitoring, operating)
* hands-on experience in Azure DevOps (Agile Board, CI/CD, WoW)
* experience in working with PWA
* sharing GitHub/projects is a plus


 Additional Information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Marta Jura via marta.jura@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**

title: Senior Software Engineer - Language Systems
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 , you will develop innovative mobile and desktop applications in a complex, cross-platform environment. You’ll design new features, contribute to architecture, and mentor junior team members. This role focuses on creating efficient language systems for users with physical and learning disabilities, requiring a passion for exploring linguistic nuances and natural language processing.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Design, develop, and deploy cross-platform products.
* Build and improve application language models and processing tools.
* Evaluate and process language data sources, collaborating with linguists and speech-language pathologists.
* Modularize components for scalability and reduce code duplication.
* Implement well-documented APIs and recommend architectural improvements.
* Debug code and communicate technical details to non-engineers.
* Follow internal coding standards and practices.


**What We're Looking For:**
* 5-7 years of software engineering experience.
* Strong background in linguistics or natural language processing.
* 5+ years of applications development experience.
* 3+ years of experience with C#, Python, and SQL.
* Proficiency in object-oriented languages (e.g., C#, C++, Java, Objective-C).
* Familiarity with NLP and machine learning libraries (e.g., NLTK, TensorFlow, spaCy).
* Experience with Linux CLI, shell scripting, regular expressions, and localization.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Next Generation: RAN Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About The Opportunity**
 If you want to join the evolution of Ericsson working with 5G, 6G and be part of one of the most exciting and demanding R&D businesses - this is the job for you!
   

  

 5G and Cloud RAN are already a reality, and Ericsson is the leader in bringing it to the market. There has never been a better time for you to make your mark. A large group of skilled developers are working energetically to convert 5G and Cloud RAN plans into reality. We are growing and looking for more talent.
   

  

 PEU (Product Engineering Unit) RAN Performance Layer 2 UPC Software is part of RAN SW & Compute Platforms Eng in BA Networks and responsible for Baseband L2 product, quality and architecture in both EMCA and GPP. We are located mainly on different sites in Sweden, Canada, China and US. This position is placed at the Stockholm Kista site.
   

  

 Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. And you will have lots of fun!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a member of design team, you will be part of developing the User Plane Control Layer (L2) components of Ericsson’s Baseband software for our world leading 5G RAN and future 6G solutions.
   

  

* Contribute in baseband in baseband product development that focus on systemization, design, testing and troubleshooting. As you will be exposed to high edge integrated and cloud RAN products.
* Participate in code reviews, testing, and quality assurance activities.
* Learn industry best practices, agile ways of working, and state-of-the-art development environments applying new knowledge to improve product innovation.


**The Skills You Bring**
* A Master’s degree(or equivalent) in telecommunications, signal processing, wireless communications, computer science, embedded, electrical/electronic fields or related fields.
* Strong foundation in embedded systems and C, C++, Python programming.
* Collaborative and Creative mindset who can easily interact with people.
* Eagerness to learn, and the courage to take initiative and ownership.
* Familiarity with Wireless communication technologies (4G/5G), 3GPP/ORAN standards, and/or signal processing is a strong plus.
* ML and AI hands on experience is a plus.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 760692

title: Senior iOS Developer
company_industry: Software Development, Financial Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we are looking to welcome a Senior iOS Developer to join one of our teams at the forefront of shaping innovative solutions and crafting modern products. If this introduction sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Meet our team**
 This role is within our Checkout team, where you'll work on multiple features of the Zettle POS. It's an exciting opportunity to tackle impactful technical challenges alongside talented peers in a cross-functional and agile team. Here, you’ll be contributing to the creation of modern products that positively impact people's lives and contribute to the success of millions of merchants worldwide.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with skilled and highly motivated engineers specializing in backend, iOS, Android, and quality assurance to deliver a world-class experience for our users. You'll benefit from their extensive delivery experience, accelerating your learning journey and enabling you to contribute to exciting features and improvements in the Payment and Orders Experience areas, serving customers at scale across multiple geolocations.
   

  

**Your day to day**
* Actively contribute to building and improving high-quality features that bring real value to our users.
* Collaborate within a cross-functional, agile team—actively participating in planning, refinement, development, and delivery of sprint goals.
* Work closely with product managers and designers to bring ideas to life, ensuring user needs and technical feasibility go hand in hand.
* Engage with fellow iOS engineers across the chapter to share knowledge, drive platform improvements, and support each other’s growth in a learning-focused environment.
* Take ownership of your scope while contributing to a strong team culture based on trust, continuous improvement, and shared responsibility.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Strong expertise in iOS development, with solid, hands-on experience in Swift and a deep understanding of building and maintaining high-quality mobile applications.
* Proven experience working with the iOS SDK and Apple’s frameworks, and the ability to leverage them effectively to develop reliable, efficient, and well-structured applications.
* Strong understanding of architectural patterns such as MVVM, and the ability to apply them in complex projects to ensure scalability and maintainability.
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools like Jenkins or Fastlane, with a focus on improving and streamlining the build, test, and deployment process.
* Commitment to writing clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, with a solid track record in applying unit testing, integration testing, and UI testing practices.
* Genuine interest in staying up to date with the latest developments in the iOS ecosystem and continuously improving your craft.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to collaborate effectively with various teams.


**We Believe in You**
 Ready to join our ride? Click "apply" or/and let's talk – We can’t wait to hear from you!
   

  

**We Believe in You!**
 Ready to lead the way? Apply now or let’s get in touch to discuss this opportunity!
   

  

 \_
   

  

 PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset-you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

title: Senior Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Senior Developer På Kleer**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om Kleer Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*
 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: AI Developer - R&D Team
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as an AI Developer - R&D Team🚀**
**Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our AI Developer.**
**About VIPAS :**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As an AI Developer, you will be responsible for everything needed to take AI/ML models to MVP status. This is a hands-on role that requires a mix of research, development, deployment, and collaboration. You’ll work closely with a talented R&D team, tackle real-world challenges, and deliver solutions that bring the most value in a resource-conscious environment.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Thrives in a collaborative and fast-moving team
* Can understand priorities and propose smart, value-driven solutions
* Has a proven track record of delivering working AI/ML solutions in large projects
* Is confident in presenting and communicating results to stakeholders


**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models from prototype to production
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define priorities and deliver value quickly
* Build and maintain ML pipelines, APIs, and user-facing components
* Implement best practices in DevOps and containerized deployments
* Stay updated on the latest trends in AI/ML and contribute to innovative solutions


**Skills & Experience We’re Looking For**
* Strong programming skills: Python (including packaging); experience with Rust and JavaScript/front-end solutions is a plus
* Kubernetes, Docker, Containerization, REST API
* Workflow & orchestration: MLFlow, Airflow, Windmill
* Data & ML platforms: Hopsworks, Palantir Foundry
* ML frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, pandas, scikit-learn
* Experience with ML architectures: GMM, HMM, LSTM, Transformers, CNN, RNN
* Experience working in DevOps environments


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

**Apply Now** 
 & Please feel free to reach me at Shrini@vipas.se or contact me at +46728479197
   

  

**Note:** 
 Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How to Apply:** 
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

**Please note!** 
 We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Embedded Software at Coody, you’ll be tackling challenges for companies and products that truly make a difference. Your role will likely include:
   

  

* Developing & Optimizing products within Embedded or Firmware Software.
* Prototyping, Testing & Debugging on real hardware, ensuring top-notch quality and reliability throughout development.
* Collaborating on product and service strategy, engineering best practices, and building strong team spirit with your client.


****Who you are****
 We’re after skilled problem-solvers who love to build, optimize, and innovate in the embedded and firmware space. You thrive in hands-on development and enjoy tackling complex technical challenges.
   

  

* At least 4-5 years of experience as an Embedded Software Engineer.
* Deep expertise in C, C++ or Embedded Python, plus experience with other embedded or firmware related areas.
* A doer’s mentality - You get things done and have a track record to prove it.
* Relevant engineering degree - Background in vehicle, electronics, computer science, mechatronics, or similar fields.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency, to apply.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Software Engineer - General
description:
**Join a Seed-Stage AI Startup Transforming Legal Compliance** 




  





**About Kalipso** 




 Join a seed-stage AI startup working with Europe's biggest FinTechs and banks to revolutionize regulatory compliance. We're building AI-powered tools to make regulatory compliance simple, transparent, and reliable for enterprises. Founded by ex-lawyers who were tired of working like in the 70s, and a top-tier ex-Klarna AI engineer who built one of the world's most advanced AI strategies.
 



  





 Our platform is built on European standards, with a strong focus on trust, data security, and a deep understanding of legal complexity. We're transforming legal and regulatory compliance from boring to empowering, and are backed by fantastic investors who are propelling us to the top of the market.
 



  





  





**The Role** 




  





 As a
 **Software Engineer** 
 at Kalipso, you'll join our small, high-delivery team focusing on your main area: backend, frontend, full stack, or data and AI. You'll build the core systems that major financial institutions depend on to accelerate their business and save millions a year.
 



  





**What you will be doing:** 



* Build core features in your specialty - backend systems, intuitive frontends, data pipelines, or advanced AI
* We believe that every employee deserves to understand the problem first hand, hence, you will get the opportunity to meet our clients and build what they truly want
* Design and implement systems that handle sensitive confidential documents at scale
* Collaborate closely with founders and our tight-knit engineering team
* Write clean, maintainable code that meets the highest security and compliance standards
* Shape product direction based on real customer feedback



  





**Who you are** 



* Proficient in Python, TypeScript, Go, or similar modern languages
* Comfortable working with APIs, databases, and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Bonus if you have experience with AI/ML, legal tech, or financial services
* Ideally have at least 2 years of experience, or can demonstrate strong skills in your area
* But most importantly, you are someone who:
* Gets stuff done and understands that building transformative compliance tech requires dedication and hard work
* Proactively solves the most critical problems facing our clients
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment where you're building solutions that didn't exist before
* Takes ownership and drives results in a small team setting



  





**What's in it for you** 



* Join at seed stage with direct access to founders and major influence on company direction
* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving fintech/AI environment
* Have a voice in shaping the product and strategy
* Be part of a small, high-delivery team where your ideas are valued and implemented quickly
* Competitive salary complemented with meaningful equity in a company solving real problems
* Flexible hybrid work setup with offices in Stockholm and Barcelona



  





 Join us and let's build something that matters.

title: C# Gameplay developer / programmer (backend)
description:
***Please note - this is an in-house role in our Stockholm office. Remote candidates will not be considered. Unfortunately we cannot help with relocation from other countries or VISA applications.***




  





**About us** 




  





 Hacksaw Studios is a company that builds online games. Our games can be played both in social gaming and real money modes. We have wide distribution and our games are played by millions of people every month by players all over the world.
 



  





 We are currently looking to expand our development team with 2-3 additional developers. You will be part of our game development team and work in a tight knit team involving both back-end developers, mathematicians, front-end developers and designers/artists. Your task will be to bring our game ideas to life in co-operation with the designers and product owners.
 



  





 We offer a nice office in central Stockholm, an opportunity to work with other experienced game developers as well as a co-ownership program for suitable candidates.
 



  





**Your tasks will include:** 




  





 - Working with the development and design team to implement the backend gameplay mechanics behind our various games
 



  





 - Working with the front-end development team to ensure the backend communications protocols make their work as simple as possible
 



  





 - Working with the game design team to implement their game ideas
 



  





 - Implementing the mathematical model underlying the games
 



  





 - Performing statistical modelling and testing to ensure the games behave as intended (We'll teach you this part)
 



  





 - Learning about the online gaming industry and stay up to date on current trends and what is popular with players
 



  





 - Participating in code reviews and merge requests
 



  





 - Co-operating with colleagues with similar roles, both in-house and with our partners
 



  





**Required skills and experience:** 




  





 - A solid backend development background
 



  





 - Experience with a programming language suited for game development, such as C#, Java or C++ (We use C#)
 



  





 - A high interest in or education in mathematics or statistics
 



  





**Other things that would be a bonus (but not required):** 




  





 - Experience with unit testing
 



  





 - University degree in a related field
 



  





 - A personal interest in gaming

title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet, Retail, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfilment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 As a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You work regularly with others to ensure the right software/engineering design approaches and methodologies are applied.
* Design, develop, deploy, operate and improve software solutions that have a direct impact on our daily business with our partners.
* Discuss and design APIs and integrated solutions.
* Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on AWS.
* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation & maintenance. Write applications from scratch with the latest technologies free of your choice.
* Shape and champion an inclusive culture and diverse team environment.


**WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
* 10+ years of software engineering experience
* You have a deep understanding of microservice architecture, REST services and API design. Good knowledge of security concepts. Highly versed in deploying and operating applications in a cloud infrastructure.
* You are highly skilled as a Java Developer. Proven experience in frameworks like Spring Boot. Ideally you have experience with a distributed event store such as Apache Kafka.
* Experience with Frontend technologies like JavaScript (ES6 / ES2015), React, Typescript, Webpack, CSS/HTML, and showing interest in full stack development is a big Plus!
* You have a good understanding of PostgreSQL and cloud architectures/platforms (preferably AWS). Check our Tech Radar for more information on the technologies we use at Zalando.
* Demonstrated strong sense of ownership, entrepreneurial & analytical thinking add to your excellent communication skills.
* Ideally, you have experience integrating third-party services, such as through developing or working with middleware solutions.
* Shopify or other e-commerce experience is a merit.


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

  

* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* Hybrid working model with 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 30 days of vacation a year
* Health and wellbeing options
* Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh\_src=22377bdd1us


*We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.*

title: Data Engineering Trainee
description:
Hey there! Are you our next Leadstar?
 



 Take the chance of a lifetime and join a market-leading, fast-paced team in the sports betting affiliate industry!
 



 We offer you:
 


* The opportunity to become an expert within data and the tools that power modern analytics
* The freedom to test your ideas and build data infrastructure that scales
* The prospect to grow within the company and take on more responsibilities
* A workplace where Mondays feel like Fridays



  





 What we want in return:
 


* A high level of commitment
* An eagerness to learn and become the best at what you do
* Smartness and curiosity about data
* A positive, solution-oriented mindset



  





 Who are we looking for?
 



  





 We are looking for a Data Engineering Trainee who will help us build, optimize, and maintain the systems that make our data flow reliably and efficiently.
 



 You are someone who wants to dive deep into data and analytics infrastructure and make sure our systems are clean, scalable, and high-performing.
 



 You don’t need to be a senior developer, but we want you to be hungry to learn. If you already have some experience with SQL or Python or any tool to process or visualize data, that’s a big plus. If not, we expect you to be excited to learn and become an expert over time.
 



 It’s also a plus if you have an interest in data, statistics, building data products or strategic thinking — but your drive and willingness to learn is what matters most.
 



  





 Job description
 



 The position as a Data Engineering Trainee is a full-time role for candidates based in Sweden.
 



 Your main task is to develop and secure our data systems to ensure clean, reliable, and scalable data - this includes:
 


* Responsibility for maintaining our databases and data pipelines from current tracking systems and data sources
* Optimizing existing data pipelines and streamlining our data flow
* Building new connections and data integrations with additional data sources



  





 There’s no limit to how much you can learn and grow in this role — it’s all up to your ambition and passion for data.
 



  





  





 About Leadstar Media
 



  





 Leadstar Media is a fast growing Swedish scale-up company that operates several websites within the sports betting industry. Today the company consists of over 70 employees and full-time consultants as well as several part-time freelancers. We are an international company with around 30 different nationalities represented and a presence in over 30 different geographical markets. Leadstar Media’s ambition is to create exceptional products for our visitors and to become the no. 1 sports betting affiliate in the world. We believe that the best way to achieve this is by having a tight-knit team of creators with a high level of autonomy.
 



 At Leadstar Media you will work together with entrepreneurial individuals who are eager to learn everything about their particular field. We want you to have the same winner mindset as the rest of the team! In addition to work, we organise other activities outside of work-hours such as small events, company trips and kick-offs.
 



  





 At Leadstar Media you always have the opportunity to grow within the company and take on more responsibility. Several of our talents have grown to become true stars and leaders. We have learned that the most important skills you need for this job are an ambition to learn, and the ability to take on responsibility.
 



  





 More info
 



 Start: As soon as possible
 



 Contract: Full-time, with a 6-month probation period
 



 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (in-office)
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Product Developer
company_industry: Restaurants and Food and Beverage Services
description:
🎯
 **About the Role** 




 Burger King is one of the world’s most iconic Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) brands, known for its flame-grilled burgers and bold, innovative marketing. As we continue our growth journey in the Scandinavian market, we are looking for a Product Developer to innovate and drive the creation and enhancement of menu items for Burger King.
 



  





 In this role, you will:
 



 · Lead product development, formulation, pilot testing, and commercialization of new products and packaging. Ensure that Taste is King!
 



 · Own ingredient sourcing, specification development, cost modeling, and supplier engagement.
 



 · Conduct customer trend analysis, consumer testing, and product research.
 



 · Collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, operations, supply chain and quality assurance to ensure seamless product launch and execution.
 



 · The role reports to Head of Menu and Execution (part of Marketing team).
 



  





 🛠️
 **Key Responsibilities** 




 · Manage the product development cycle based on the marketing calendar through launch, targeting consistent quality and cost-efficiency.
 



 · Develop ingredients and document formulations, and process specifications.
 



 · Collaborate with our supplier’s R&D chefs (where applicable) or cross-functional teams to balance culinary innovation with technical scalability. Participate in product ideation sessions and coordinate with suppliers to develop new ingredients.
 



 · Conduct market research and incorporate consumer insights into product innovation and improvement.
 



 · Present new product proposals to marketing or leadership teams.
 



 · Collaborate together with operations to ensure that the products or packaging works well in the restaurants in terms of shelf-life, equipment etc.
 



 · In summary the role is a stimulating mix of both practical work to test burgers and other products in our restaurants and to prepare necessary documentation for a successful launch.
 



 · The role might include traveling on a bi-monthly basis between our offices in Stockholm, Oslo and Copenhagen and to various suppliers within Scandinavia.
 



  





 📚
 **Qualifications** 




 · Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Food Science, Food Technology, Culinary Science, Marketing or equivalent.
 



 · 3–5 years of experience in product development (or Product/Brand Management) within the food service or consumer food industry. Experience with QSR operations or franchise models is a strong advantage.
 



 · Strong technical and culinary understanding; familiarity with sensory methods, ingredient technology, and nutritional labeling.
 



 · Excellent project management, cost modeling, and analytical skills.
 



 · Effective communication skills, able to articulate concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders across regions. Fluency in English and either Swedish, Danish or Norwegian.
 



  





 💡
 **Ideal Personal Attributes** 




 · Food and products as passion.
 



 · Proactive, structured, creative thinker comfortable working under changing priorities. Resilient mindset—handling iterative development where not all ideas make it to launch is commonplace; focus on long-term impact.
 



 · Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and ability to multitask.
 



 · Collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional and global environments.
 



  





 🎁
 **What we offer** 




 · Great career opportunity in a solid international organization with growth ambitions.
 



 · Opportunity to develop your tasks and shape your area of expertise.
 



 · Competitive salary and benefits.
 



 · Enjoy a flexible work environment – based at our Stockholm office.
 



 · Discount at all our restaurants.

title: Product Developer for Edition & Campaign - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a
 **Product Developer** 
 with a strong sense of style and commercial eye to join our
 **Edition & Campaign team** 
 focused on knitwear within our Womenswear Assortment at H&M!
   

  

 As a Product Developer, you will play an important part in the exciting process of shaping the Edition & Campaign collections as part of the Womenswear assortment. You will define and execute both short- and long-term strategies for this category, ensuring alignment with our overall assortment goals. Leveraging your fashion intelligence, salesmanship, and commercial insight, you’ll drive seasonal keys and act on emerging trends. You will continuously refine our product and component strategy to drive growth and profitability.
   

  

 In this role, you will be part of driving initiatives forward in a fast-paced environment and work with youthful, elevated fashion products that welcome everyone! Our target customers are fashion forward women who aspire to the latest trends, from current essentials to fashion must haves. You will work alongside a small talented team with a strong passion for products and fashion, where you will be an essential part of creating world-class products that resonate with our customers.
   

  

**Who you are:**
* Proven experience from a similar role as Product Developer
* Education in Textiles, Buying or Product Development
* Preferably a proven track record in creating products for the womenswear customer with a high fashion level
* A keen eye for current and upcoming fashion trends with strong fashion intelligence
* A deep passion for products and product development
* Extensive material knowledge
* Driven, structured and proactive in taking initiatives
* Salesmanship and results-oriented mindset
* Excellent communication skills
* A strong team player with a flexible attitude
* Ability to identify opportunities, improvements and efficient solutions


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
**Additional information:**
 This is a full-time permanent position, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV latest 8 Sep 2025** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

**Benefits:**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity:**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.

title: Utvecklare Power Platform & M365 till Sogeti Stockholm
description:
Brinner du precis som vi för att utveckla smartare sätt att jobba med hjälp av ny teknik? Då har du säkert inte undgått att Microsoft Power Platform växer ute på marknaden med rekordfart!
   

  

**Din roll:**
 Som utvecklare inom Power Platform och Microsoft 365 arbetar du med att bygga moderna, affärsdrivna lösningar som effektiviserar kundens processer. Du utvecklar appar, automatiserar arbetsflöden och integrerar lösningar med Microsofts ekosystem. Du fungerar som teknisk rådgivare och är ofta drivande i lösningsdesign och implementation.
   

  

**Din profil:**
* 4+ års erfarenhet av utveckling inom Power Platform och Microsoft 365
* Djup förståelse för affärsprocesser och hur de kan digitaliseras med Microsofts verktyg
* Erfarenhet av integrationer med externa system via API:er och Azure-tjänster
* Certifiering: Power Platform Developer Associate eller motsvarande
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av lösningsarkitektur och governance inom Power Platform
* Talar och skriver svenska flytande.


**Tekniska erfarenheter:**
* Power Platform: Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI,Power Pages, Copilots (PVA), AI Builder, Power Platform admin center
* Microsoft 365: SharePoint Online, Teams, OneDrive, Outlook
* Dataverse, Azure Functions, Logic Apps
* JavaScript, TypeScript, .NET


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
* Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
* Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
* Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


**Ansökan:**
 Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Simon Karlsson på simon.karlsson@sogeti.se
   

  

 Nu när sommaren är här och många av oss njuter av lite välförtjänt ledighet, kan det hända att processen tar lite längre tid än vanligt. Vi återkommer så snart vi är tillbaka från semestern! Tack för ditt tålamod och för att du visat intresse för oss på Sogeti. Vi önskar dig en riktigt härlig sommar fylld med sol, vila och glädje!
   

  

**Om oss**
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Senior Developer - Telecom Mobile Test Probes
company_industry: Telecommunications, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Hi, I'm Zandile Vanqa, your Recruiter and guide to joining CSG. At CSG, you're more than your CV. We value your unique background and believe your perspective will help us elevate the work we do together. By channelling the power of all, we transform ordinary experiences into extraordinary ones- for both our customers and our employees. Channel the power of YOU and begin the journey to becoming a CSGer.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 Are you passionate about software development for mobile network integration? Join our team to help take our telecom testing technology to new heights.
   

  

 The CSG Stockholm team is developing an advanced telecom testing software solution called CSG Assure used by mobile operators across the globe, including leading operators like AT&T, Tata, Orange.
   

  

 CSG Assure is an artificial test traffic generation platform consisting of a cloud-based application, controllers and test probes located in around 200 countries globally.
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled developer to be part of our small, agile team to build applications that help our mobile operator customers validate and optimize mobile service performance for their roamers and local subscribers.
   

  

 You will develop our next-generation mobile test probe for 3G, 4G, 5G and IoT to simulate mobile users using voice, SMS and data services. Main development is done in C & C++ on Linux platform.
   

  

* You will develop our next-generation mobile test probe for 3G, 4G, 5G and IoT to simulate mobile users using voice, SMS and data services. Main development is done in C & C++ on Linux platform.
* You are a highly skilled, analytical, customer-focused person with a strong developer profile that enjoys taking responsibility, making sure our customers get full value of our high-tech solutions
* You will report to the Executive Director Product & Development


**You Should Have**
* Completed Degree in Computer Science or related field
* 5+ years of professional experience in software development, preferably in telecom
* Strong proficiency in C++, data structures, multi-threading and Linux system programming
* Solid understanding of AT command sets and modem communication
* Good knowledge of mobile network technologies (3G, 4G, IMS/VoLTE, 5G, IoT) and network signaling (e.g. SIP, RRC, NAS) as defined in 3GPP
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


**Bonus Skills**
* Android development experience
* Understanding of eUICC/eSIM, GSMA standards
* Experience with network monitoring tools and protocol analyzers like Wireshark, QCAT
* Familiarity with scripting languages, e.g. LUA, Shell, Perl


**Why should you apply?**
* Opportunity to work and grow your skillset in cutting-edge technologies
* Provide solutions to world-leading communication service providers
* Be part of a collaborative, innovative, international team


**Who Will Love This Job**
* A trusted team player – You foster a respectful and inclusive environment and value diverse voices.
* A growth driver – You are eager to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment.
* A game changer – You embrace innovation and push boundaries in digital media.
* A communicator – You translate complex ideas into engaging and accessible content.


*Key Words: Senior Developer, Software Engineer, Mobile Networks, C++, Linux, Modem Communication, Telecom Software*
**Location(s):**
 SE.Stockholm.Office
   

  

**Accommodation:**
 If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with CSG and need special assistance due to a disability or accommodation for a disability throughout any aspect of the application process, please call us at +1 (402) 431-7440 or email us at accommodations@csgi.com. CSG provides accommodations for persons with disabilities in employment, including during the hiring process and any interview and/or testing processes.
   

  

**Our Guiding Principles:**
**Impact:** 
 Always help and empower others, whether they’re colleagues or customers. When our employees set their minds to something, great things happen.
   

  

**Integrity:** 
 Do what’s right for our customers and our people while being authentic. We treat everyone with trust and respect—that’s just who we are.
   

  

**Inspiration:** 
 Be bold in the way you think and passionate about the work you do. Test out innovative ideas without the fear of failure.
   

  

**Our Story:**
 CSG empowers companies to build unforgettable experiences, making it easier for people and businesses to connect with, use and pay for the services they value most. For over 40 years, CSG's technologies and people have helped some of the world's most recognizable brands solve their toughest business challenges and evolve to meet the demands of today's digital economy.
   

  

 By channeling the power of all, we make ordinary customer and employee experiences extraordinary. Our people [CSGers] are fearlessly committed and connected, high on integrity and low on ego, making us the easiest company to do business with and the best place to work. We power a culture of integrity, innovation, and impact across our locations, representing the most authentic version of ourselves to build a better future together. That's just who we are. Learn more about CSG Inclusion & Impact here.

title: Expert FPGA developer, C Stockholm
description:
**Beskrivning**
 Expert FPGA developer med minst 10 års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Personen ska snabbt kunna sätta sig in i VHLD-kod och kunna förstå problematiken, kunna ansvara för egen utveckling i ett team samt kunna arbeta självständigt med både VHDL-utveckling, test bänkar samt i ett labb med verifiering.
   

  

 Meriterande är kunskap med verktyget Libero.
