title: UX Lead – Drive the Future of Automotive Software
description:
We are looking for an experienced UX Lead for an on-site consulting assignment starting October 2025. You will play a key role in shaping intuitive tools and solutions that make complex processes simple, efficient, and enjoyable to use.
  
  

Your mission
  
Lead all UX activities and ensure valuable, desirable and user-friendly experiences
  
Create and implement a UX strategy that aligns with the overall vision and goals
  
Collaborate closely with product owners, engineers, and cross-functional teams
  
Mentor teams and leaders in user-centered design methodologies
  
Raise the UX maturity level by introducing standards, routines, and training
  
Communicate design concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences
  
Support the design of tools for parameter documentation, diagnostics, and modernization projects
  
Contribute to secure and efficient software development and deployment environments
  
  

What we are looking for
  
️ Senior UX professional with proven experience in leading UX work
  
️ Solid background in designing for complex technical systems
  
️ Strong communicator who can bridge business, tech, and design
  
️ Experience working in agile environments with fast-paced, iterative development
  
️ Ability to coach, inspire, and develop teams and individuals
  
️ Comfortable balancing strategic vision with hands-on design work
  
️ Located in Gothenburg, able to work on-site at Lindholmen Science Center
  
  

Assignment details
  
**Start:** 6 October 2025
  
**End:** 2 October 2026
  
**Location:** Gothenburg (on-site)
  
  

Sway Sourcing is an innovative recruitment partner specializing in matching the right talent with the right company—quickly and efficiently. Our primary focus lies in Finance, Administration, HR, Marketing, and IT, but we also have the broad expertise and flexibility required to deliver tailored recruitment solutions across all industries.
  
  

Although we are a relatively new player, we have already gained the trust of many of Sweden's largest companies and operate both nationally and internationally. With bases in Sweden and Spain, we offer a unique combination of local expertise and global reach. Our strong network and deep industry insights make us the obvious partner for companies looking to stay ahead in their recruitment efforts.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Due to legacy and T3 demands, the SW documentation needs to be improved with a new way of handling parameters documentation, a new Parameter Matrix tool, a UX designer professional is needed to help us design a tool that is intuitive and easy to use. There are other solutions in the R&D modernization scope that would also benefit if an UX designer is dedicated 100% for the SW and diagnostics VSF flow domain, like the Dependix solution.


Consequences if an UX designer is not in place: complex logic to be implemented in the user interface, if the right competences are not employed, there is a high risk of additional time required from users to be trained, to accomplish tasks, and increased risk of introducing manual errors by users.

  

* Orchestrate all UX activities to drive the development of our digital solutions ensuring valuable, desirable and intuitive experiences.
* Mentor and guide product owners, scrum masters, and development teams in embracing user-centered design methodologies, fostering effective collaboration to deliver business value aligned with user needs.
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, product owners, engineers, and other stakeholders.
* Communicate design concepts and rationale clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Develop and articulate a comprehensive UX strategy that aligns with the company's overall vision and goals.
* Elevate the overall maturity level of UX practices, consistently monitoring usability performance across digital platforms.
* Provide training and guidance to team members, ensuring they possess the necessary skills and knowledge to deliver outstanding user experiences.
* Demonstrate expertise in designing user experiences for various devices across diverse digital environments
* Familiarity with agile delivery methodologies and experience in fast-paced, iterative development cycles.
* People leadership, building and growing the team’s skills, professional development, performance and growth.


You will be working for Core Platform Area SW & Diagnostics situated in Digital & IT.


Our objectives are to deliver value in two value flows called Vehicle SW Factory (VSF) and Vehicle SW Deploy (VSD).


VSFs focus is to enable with methods and tools (CI/CD/CT including calibration) to create embedded software with time to market - in Product Development, Manufacturing and Aftermarket for all Volvo Groups business areas.


VSDs focus is to enable update of vehicle software in a secure way – In Product Development, Manufacturing, Aftermarket and Customer context for all Volvo Groups business areas. This is where your primary focus will be.

title: VP of Engineering
description:
**The opportunity**
-------------------

Here at Waitwhile we're on a mission to eliminate the 1 trillion hours that people spend waiting in lines every year. Our platform is trusted by over 10,000 companies worldwide and has helped more than 150 million people enjoy a radically better waiting experience.  

  

We're looking for an incredible VP of Engineering who will support Waitwhile's mission by building a world class engineering culture and team, shaping our technology & product roadmap, and championing our vision for building the best platform for our users. You'll report to our CEO and work collaboratively with our CTO and other members of the Waitwhile team to build innovative tech.


We put empathy at the heart of our interactions because we believe that this trait is the most important one for effective teams. We believe in transparency and we practice what we preach. **As the VP of Engineering**, you will play a key role in setting the long-term direction of Waitwhile's global engineering strategy that you will help build, develop, and execute.


The ideal candidate will be an empathetic communicator and an excellent cross-functional collaborator who has experience scaling world-class technical organizations. They are a hands-on engineering leader that has experience across the technical stack, are pragmatic in their approach to software development, and are capable of making fast, practical, and effective technology decisions.

**What you’ll own**
-------------------

* The Waitwhile engineering team, consisting of 20+ geographically distributed software engineers. You will partner with product development, operations, design and UX, product marketing and analytics to heavily inform the Product roadmap with your technical perspective.
* Delivery execution excellence: the overarching delivery schedule and quality of product features we conceive, build and ship to delight our current customers and win new ones.
* Reliability, uptime and operations: the fundamentals that ensure Waitwhile exceeds SLAs and is developed sustainably to continually optimize the ongoing cost of its support and maintenance.
* Engineering talent management: the responsibility to set performance management standards that cultivate and groom personal growth within your organization.
* Cross technology organizational relationships: the ability to cross boundaries and develop strong relationships with our pre and post sales team leaders and our customers.

**What skills you need**
------------------------

* 10-15+ years experience in technical organizational leadership.
* Experience in high growth, dynamic, distributed teams.
* Proven ability to set technical vision and build the technical product roadmap from launch to scale.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, diplomacy, and humility to lead and develop strong working relationships.
* Very strong analytical and problem solving skills including requirements analysis and risk assessment.
* Experience working with stakeholders to create hiring strategies to recruit and develop quality teams.
* Knowledgeable about industry trends and best practices.
* Ability to identify opportunities and challenges in the marketplace by constantly evaluating emerging and/or innovating technologies.
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a closely related discipline is a big plus.

**A great place to work ️**
---------------------------


We want Waitwhile to be an incredible place to work. We offer great benefits and perks, flexible working hours and lots of interesting challenges. We believe in making work fun and rewarding and care about your development and are committed to your success.


*Waitwhile has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. We aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?*

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Offerta och IPIS har blivit Tom, Sveriges största tjänsteförmedling för bygg, flytt och städ. I vår portfölj av varumärken skapar vi transparens och tar bort hinder från bokningsprocessen - i korthet gör vi det enkelt för hantverkare att hitta nya jobb, och kunder att få jobbet gjort, från start till klart.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en designer som älskar hela designprocessen - från hypotesarbete till pixel perfect UI. Du kommer att ingå i en kombinerad tech- och produktorganisation med fantastiska kollegor.
   

  

**Din roll**
* Du driver, dokumenterar och utvecklar designprocess och designsystem.
* Du arbetar hypotesdrivet tillsammans med PM:s - från research, till färdig design och uppföljning.
* Du identifierar förbättringsmöjligheter genom användartester, A/B-tester och användningsdata.
* Du lär känna våra kunder och stakeholders för att översätta deras behov till fantastiska kundupplevelser.
* Du visualiserar högkvalitativa UI och jobbar tillsammans med utvecklare för att snabbt testa och iterera.


**Vad vi söker**
* En prestigelös, initiativtagande lagspelare som hugger i där det krävs och är van att jobba nära och kommunicera med kunder, PM:s, utvecklare, marknad och sälj.
* Akademisk examen inom till exempel design eller HCI.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av UX/UI-design från produktbolag eller en portfolio som visar på motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Du är van att arbeta i Figma.


**Bonus om du har:**
* Grundläggande förståelse för front-end-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av komponentbaserade designsystem.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba i Google Analytics.


 För att trivas hos oss tror vi att du är hjälpsam, pragmatisk och värdesätter farten hos ett entreprenöriellt bolag. Det spelar mindre roll om du inte checkar alla boxar eller är i början av din karriär - vi lägger mycket vikt vid initiativförmåga och känsla för bra kundupplevelser. På Tom vill vi skapa en kultur där våra användare är i centrum. Vi värdesätter transparens, prestigelöshet och att få saker gjorda.
   

  

**Förmåner**
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* 30 semesterdagar
* Frukost på kontoret på onsdagar
* Centralt kontor i Stockholm


 Vi arbetar på kontoret, antingen i Stockholm eller Uppsala. Tjänsten utgår främst från Stockholmskontoret som ligger i nyrenoverade lokaler precis ovanpå centralstationen.
   

  

 Bifoga gärna en portfolio när du skickar in din ansökan.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tillträde: Snarast eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Arbetstid: Heltid
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdatum: Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Johan Liedgren på fornamn.efternamn@tom.se.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: User Researcher
description:
**Role Description**
 As a User Researcher, you will play a crucial role in supporting the team's research efforts. You will be a valued member of Conversionista's insights team, which combines quantitative data and qualitative data to provide valuable insights through triangulation. Your research will contribute to the ongoing optimization process and help generate actionable insights for our clients.
   

  

 You have the confidence to make independent decisions, but also possess a humble and flexible attitude when it comes to adapting your approach to meet the needs and conditions of our clients. You have a strong passion for data-driven methods and a deep understanding of user behavior and experience. Additionally, you bring valuable experience in the field of user research and human behavior, whether through relevant academic background or solid working experience in the industry.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In your role, you will employ a combination of quantitative and qualitative user research methods. Your aim will be to collect and analyze data in a structured manner, presenting it to stakeholders in a way that is easily understandable and actionable.
   

  

 You will collaborate with various teams and utilize your expertise to train client team members on conducting appropriate user research methods. It's important to note that your projects may vary in duration, and you may work either on short-term assignments or be stationed at a specific client, this will change over time.
   

  

 We put a big emphasis on study design and believe that defining the research question and selecting the right methodology is the key component of being a user researcher at Conversionista!
   

  

* Work closely with a cross-functional, geographically distributed team of data scientists/analysts and user researchers
* Define, plan, and conduct user research
* Deliver compelling insights to help drive evidence-based product and design decisions.
* Contribute to the wider Insights team at Conversionista


**Typical deliverables**
* Qualitative research such as usability tests, user interviews, user journey mapping, customer feedback analysis, card sorting, personas etc.
* Basic quantitative data analyses from e.g. surveys, Hotjar, Contentsquare, Google Analytics, or equivalent
* Presentations and reports of research findings and insights
* Preparation for, and facilitation of, workshops based on the research
* Stakeholder management
* Setup and apply processes for continuous research work
* Setup and apply processes for data sharing within organizations


**Where You'll Be**
 Our team is spread across Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö, with offices in each of these cities. The specific location where you will work will vary depending on client and/or project. For this role in particular we require you to be based in (or around) Stockholm.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You possess a people-oriented mindset and thrive in a flexible and adaptive work environment. You enjoy working iteratively and are proactive in driving initiatives forward. Your curiosity is fueled by an interest in behavioral psychology, and you have a strong focus on data. You are both confident and humble, finding joy in educating others. With your patient and analytical mindset, you approach challenges with a user-centered perspective. You excel in communication, possess critical thinking skills, and have the ability to empathize with different perspectives. Your data-driven approach and storytelling capabilities make you a valuable asset to the team.
   

  

* You have a degree in Psychology, Human-Computer Interaction, Social Science, Behavior Science or a related field or the equivalent of 2+ years of related professional experience.
* Comfortable with conducting, analyzing and communicating research in a zero-to-one space.
* You have experience with both qualitative and quantitative research methods such as diary studies, usability tests, in-depth interviews, contextual inquiry, surveys and more.
* Have strong interpersonal skills and can easily connect with your partners in product, tech, business and design.
* A dedicated advocate of a user-centered approach to product development, while also balancing business needs.
* You have worked in a research role at a consumer-focused or a business-to-business company.
* You have professional proficiency in Swedish as you will be conducting usability tests with Swedish users on Swedish websites. However, our company language is English.


 We are conversion optimizers who help our clients use actual data instead of guesses. Armed with scientific methods, we reveal our customers’ growth potential and help them reach their business goals.
   

  

 We currently have over 60 conversion heroes in our five offices in Stockholm, Amsterdam, Oslo, Gothenburg, and Malmö.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective, we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: CPO (Sweden)
description:
Key Responsibilities:
 * Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap, aligning with the company’s strategic goals and market opportunities.
* Lead the product management team in the planning, development, and execution of new products and enhancements to existing products.
* Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, encouraging the development of market-leading products that meet customer needs.
* Collaborate with other C-level executives to integrate product strategies with company-wide initiatives, including marketing, sales, and technology.
* Conduct market research and analysis to stay ahead of industry trends and leverage insights in product development.
* Oversee the product lifecycle from concept through launch and beyond, ensuring products achieve planned goals.
* Engage with customers and key stakeholders to gather feedback and refine product offerings.
* Establish metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) for the product team, monitoring performance to ensure targets are met.


 Required Qualifications:
 * Proven experience as a CPO or in a similar senior product management role, preferably within the gaming,
 **i-gaming** 
 , or fin-tech sectors.
* Demonstrated ability to lead a product team and drive product strategy in a competitive market.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make decisions based on both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate ideas and persuade stakeholders.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications in product management are highly advantageous.

title: Mobile Software Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a Mobile Developer Consultant at Coody, you’ll dive into technically challenging and engaging assignments that help companies level up their teams and projects. You’ll be crafting high-quality, efficient, and maintainable code using native or hybrid platforms (such as Android, iOS, React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform or Flutter). You will collaborate close with other engineers, designers, product people and other teams to build mobile experiences for some of the most exciting brands within tech.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. New challenges? Bring them on. We see them as opportunities for growth. Typically, you’ll take on 1-2 different assignments per year. Are you ready to make a difference?
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for a Mobile Developer with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a doer’s mindset. Here’s what we’re after:
   

  

* Strong expertise in either Swift, Kotlin, Flutter or React Native
* Unit testing experience and a solid understanding of the release cycle, and CI/CD
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics (or similar)
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Frontend Engineer, Healthtech
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Hospitals and Health Care, and Software Development
description:
**Join us in shaping better Healthcare!** 




 Platform24 is on a mission to unlock the potential of healthcare by creating smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available.
 



  





 Joining our team as a Frontend Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech tech companies, with the largest market adoption in the Nordics. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a major scale.
 



  





 Our diverse team, consisting of frontend and backend engineers, QA, UX designers, a product manager, and an engineering manager, collaborates closely to achieve these objectives.
 



 You and your team will have end-to-end ownership of your area of Platform24's solutions, which encompasses everything from the UI to backend services and DevOps.
 



  





**What you will be doing:** 



* Implement responsive and user-friendly designs using Typescript and React.
* Participate in and contribute to software architecture discussions
* Troubleshoot and resolve frontend issues
* Ensure that the services are performing according to expectations in production
* Collaborate with the other members of your cross-functional team to ensure the creation of high-quality products
* Contribute to our ways of working every day, improving how we collaborate and do things



  





**What we offer:** 



* Working collaboratively with diverse teams
* Working in a structured and systematic way
* Language learning courses
* Friendly environment, flexible work hours, and promote work-life balance



  





**This is how you will succeed:** 



* You are comfortable in frontend development (preferably React and Typescript, and React-Native)
* You have experience working with State management, like Redux or React Query
* You have experience working with testing tools
* You have experience with code bundlers and module federation
* You are a team player with good collaboration skills
* You are curious to learn new technologies
* You have strong communication skills in English
* You have a university degree in Software Engineering or equivalent



  





**Being part of the P24 Team:** 




 At Platform24, we understand that everyone has unique needs when it comes to organizing their lives. That's why we prioritize flexible working hours to promote work-life balance for all. Additionally, we host Demo & Beers sessions every other week, providing a platform to share our achievements (beers optional!). We prioritize personal growth and offer a range of benefits, including the opportunity to dedicate five workdays a year to volunteer work. Our office is stocked with snacks, and we host regular parties. Moreover, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with intelligent, friendly, and talented colleagues from all over the world.
 



 Our culture is one of our strongest competitive advantages and through our behavior, we are all part of recreating it every day while building healthcare 2.0.
 



  





**Apply:** 




 If you believe we're the right workplace for you and you're the right fit for us, submit your application today! We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply soon..
 



 We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
 



 This role is a full-time employment with Platform24. We do not offer contractor and/or B2B types of engagements.

title: Technical Recruiter
description:
**Title:** 
 Tech Recruiter
 



**Reports to:** 
 Lead Recruiter
 



**Entity:** 
 MAMUK
 **Group:** 
 People
 **Capability:** 
 Talent Acquisition
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm Office, Sweden - 3 Days/Week
 



  





  





**Who we’re looking for** 




 We don’t just hire engineers – we find visionaries who build platforms that simulate complex systems, model real-world physics, and redefine immersive design.
 



 At Metrea, our teams create digital jets, simulators, and software that prepare real pilots for real missions – blending aerospace precision, game design creativity, and data science rigor.
 



 From data engineers optimizing performance, to aircraft engineers modelling flight dynamics, to UX designers crafting mission interfaces – every role shapes the future of defense technology. As a Tech Recruiter, you’ll source top talent for these positions, focusing on the UK, Sweden, and Poland.
 



 You’ll be the strategist behind our talent pipeline: speaking engineers’ language, spotting the best candidates, and sharing the thrill of building tools that protect national security. Ready to recruit the minds behind the machines?
 



  





**Company Overview** 




 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects-as-a-service across Aerospace, Electromagnetic & Cyber, Digital & Synthetic domains via its capability groups. Metrea also consists of six support groups (Operations, People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Solutions) that guide the development of specific capabilities that Metrea's files (product, projects, programs etc) leverage to achieve their targets.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




  




* Full-Cycle Recruitment:
 
 Manage the end-to-end hiring process for technical roles including sourcing, screening, coordinating interviews, feedback management, and offer negotiations.
* Stakeholder Partnership:
 
 Build strong relationships with hiring managers by learning business needs and providing timely recruiting support and insights on candidate profiles and market trends.
* Strategic Sourcing:
 
 Identify, engage, and nurture pipelines of qualified candidates using creative sourcing techniques and recruiting platforms. Focus areas may span engineering, data science, architecture, and simulation.
* Candidate Experience:
 
 Deliver a transparent and empathetic candidate journey by fostering trust, providing clear communication, and showcasing alignment with Metrea’s mission and values.
* Talent Market Awareness:
 
 Stay up to date on talent movement, compensation trends, and skill-set availability across technical domains to inform search strategies and outreach efforts.
* ATS & Recruiting Tools:
 
 Maintain accurate candidate records and leverage recruiting platforms to track progress, communicate efficiently, and streamline workflows.
* Insights-Driven Delivery:
 
 Use recruiting metrics and feedback to refine processes, anticipate bottlenecks, and improve overall time-to-fill and pipeline quality.
* Team Collaboration:
 
 Contribute to a collaborative and supportive recruiting culture by sharing ideas, embracing feedback, and engaging with colleagues across the People Team.



  





  





**What you’ll bring** 




  




* Rooted in Humility:
 
 You value the universal over the personal. Maximizing what you know, skeptically filtering what you believe you know, and further limiting what you project to know.
* Proven Experience:
 
 Previous experience as a technical recruiter in a similar role. Bonus if in the defense/aerospace industry, but not required.
* Sourcing Expertise:
 
 Proficient in modern sourcing tools and platforms (e.g. LinkedIn Recruiter, Cord, Boolean search) to identify and engage with technical candidates.
* Communication Skills:
 
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build trust, credibility, and influence stakeholders and candidates alike.
* Market Knowledge:
 
 Familiarity with a wide range of Swedish (primary) talent markets, including key talent pools and industry trends.
* Detail-Oriented, Systematic approach
 
 : Strong attention to detail with a process-driven approach to sourcing and candidate management.
* Collaborative Mindset:
 
 Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced complex environment, collaborating with multiple stakeholders across different teams and time zones.



  





**Group Overview** 




 Metrea Management is our global shared service providing support for the Capability Units (CU) in areas such as People, Finance, Legal, Strategy and Information Technology.
 



 The Talent Acquisition team at Metrea are trusted partners embedded in the mission. We partner across capability units and support groups to identify, engage, and onboard the technical and operational talent that powers Metrea’s effects-as-a-service model.
 



 Rooted in humility and driven by precision, our team blends data-driven recruiting with deep human insight. We understand the stakes of national security and the urgency of innovation, and we recruit accordingly – with speed, discernment, and an unwavering commitment to excellence. Whether scaling emerging capabilities or reinforcing core teams, we build the workforce that builds Metrea.
 



  





**Our Firmware** 




 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
 



  





**Benefits** 




 Friskvård of 5K annually
 



 Personal development budget (2K for books, courses, subscriptions etc)
 



 Parental leave
 



 5% occupational pension (swe. tjänstepension),
 



 30 days of leave
 



 Discretionary Bonus
 



  





  





**AAP/EEO Statement** 




 Metrea Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
 



  





**Reasonable Accommodations Statement** 




 To perform this role successfully, an individual must be able to perform the responsibilities outlined in this job description to a satisfactory standard. Reasonable
 



 accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with additional needs to
 



 perform the essential functions.
 



  





  





**Disclosure Statement** 




 The Company has reviewed this job description to ensure that essential functions and
 



 basic duties have been included. It is intended to provide guidelines for job expectations
 



 and the employee’s ability to perform the position described. It is not intended to be
 



 construed as an exhaustive list of all functions, responsibilities, skills and abilities.
 



 Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed
 



 appropriate. This document does not represent a contract of employment, and the
 



 Company reserves the right to change this job description and/or assign tasks for the
 



 employee to perform, as the Company deems necessary.
 



  





**Right to Work** 




 The employee will have the legal right to work in the UK or Sweden and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
 



  





**Equal Opportunities Statement** 




 Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
 



  





**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work (please verify the below information)** 




 This is a full-time non-exempt position with typical working hours of Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Hours and work shifts may change in accordance with department and business needs. Exempt Employees must have the ability to be on-call and available, as business needs require. Non-Exempt employees may be required to work over 40 hours per week with approval from the department manager.
 



  





**Work Location** 




 Sweden
 



**Work Environment** 




 This job operates in an office setting
 



**Travel** 




 Occasional travel to London

title: Software Developer
job_function: Information Technology, Product Management, and Engineering
description:
**About The Role**
 At Nasdaq, we’re rewriting the future of global markets. As a Software Developer, you’ll be part of a dynamic team that designs, develops, and maintains cutting-edge software solutions that power the financial world.
   

  

 You’ll work on both new and existing applications, contributing to systems architecture and infrastructure. This is a fantastic opportunity to grow your skills while making a real impact in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, develop, test, and implement software solutions.
* Modify and enhance existing applications to improve performance and usability.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand system requirements and business processes.
* Ensure compatibility across multiple platforms and browsers.
* Support and maintain software tools, utilities, and operating system components.
* Contribute to security solutions and system improvements.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Education: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
* Some experience in one or more programming/scripting languages (e.g. Java) is mertiting
* A passion for learning and collaborating with experienced peers.
* Previous experience within the financial sector is meriting


**We Offer:**
* Annual monetary bonus
* Employee Stock Purchase Program - Nasdaq stocks with a discount
* Unlimited access to e-learning platforms (Udemy Business, financial e-trainings, mentorship programs, and so on)
* Flex day program (up to 6 days a year)
* Additional benefits such as private medical insurance and sport activities
* Internal mentorship program – get a mentor or become one


**What happens now?**
 This is a full-time permanent position located in Stockholm. Nasdaq offers a hybrid workplace to find a balance between working from home and collaborating in the office, therefore it's required to come into the office at least 3 days per week. If you think you would thrive in this role, then we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume in English as soon as possible, as the selection is ongoing. A valid work permit in EU is mandatory.
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: Senior React Native Engineer
description:
**Northmill Bank is a Swedish fintech company dedicated to revolutionizing the way we manage and protect our finances. We're creating a different kind of banking experience — digital yet personal.** 




 Founded in 2006, Northmill has grown to over 200 employees across 3 countries, 2,500 merchants, and 600,000 users. We use the latest technology to build secure, smart, and user-friendly products for both consumers and businesses. Our customers are the reason we do what we do. We're a 100% cloud-based product company where technology drives everything we build.
 



 Take the chance to be a part of us and our journey!
   





**About the role:** 




 As a
 **Senior React Native Engineer** 
 , you’ll join a cross-functional product team and play a key role in shaping and building our mobile and web banking applications. You’ll work hands-on with
 **React Native** 
 ,
 **React.js** 
 , and
 **TypeScript** 
 , contributing to both the technical foundation and the user experience of our products.
 



 You’ll help build customer-facing features for digital banking — including payments, credit, and personal finance tools — all designed to improve financial wellbeing.
 



 You’ll work closely with backend developers, designers, and product managers to bring new features to life — always with performance, security, and usability in mind. You’ll also help guide architectural decisions and continuously improve our ways of working.
 



 You’ll be based in
 **Stockholm** 
 , working alongside a local and international team, including our Engineering Center in
 **Katowice, Poland** 
 . 
 



  





**Your background:** 



+ Solid experience in building
 **mobile and/or web applications**
+ Strong skills in
 **React Native** 
 (CLI or Expo) and
 **TypeScript**
+ Experience with
 **React.js** 
 and building component-based UIs
+ Familiar with
 **web services and APIs**
+ Comfortable using modern dev practices (code reviews, CI/CD, testing)
+ Exposure to
 **Agile** 
 workflows



  





 You are a
 **creative and curious person** 
 with a genuine interest in software development. You’re excited about exploring new technologies and trends, and you enjoy sharing knowledge with your team.
 



 Like us, you probably love writing clean, high-quality code — and you're not afraid to flag issues or suggest better solutions. You're a true team player who thrives in a collaborative, agile environment.
   





**Bonus points if you also have:** 



* Experience with native
 **Android and/or iOS** 
 development
* A degree in
 **Computer Science** 
 , Engineering, or a related field
* Backend experience NestJS, GraphQL and familiar with Accessibility (a11y)



  





**What we offer:**



* A key role in a
 **product-first** 
 , cloud-native tech company
* The chance to shape both
 **technical architecture** 
 and
 **product direction**
* A modern office in the heart of
 **Stockholm** 
 , with a rooftop terrace and stunning views
* Collaboration with talented, humble colleagues in a flat organization
* Competitive compensation and benefits
* Support for your learning and development
* An open, friendly culture that values ideas over titles



  





**Fun Facts:** 



+ Daily
 **breakfast** 
 , fresh fruit, and our sacred
 **Friday fika**
+ Generous
 **wellness allowance** 
 and regular visits from a massage therapist
+ A treadmill in one of our conference rooms (yes, really!)
+ Legendary
 **“Northchill” afterworks** 
 and
 **“Northcon”** 
 – our own internal conference (often held abroad)
+ Celebrated team wins, product launches, and milestones together
+ A team-first, non-corporate culture with space for big ideas and small rituals



  





**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
*Come help develop systems that make life easier for restaurants - and see your work used nationwide!* 




  





**About the Company** 




 Founded by restaurant owners in 2018, the company is on a mission to help restaurants streamline their operations. Today, over 1500 restaurants rely on their platform for table ordering, self-service kiosks, and online orders.
 



  





 They’re a tight-knit and innovative team where your work will directly shape their product and make a real impact on their partners.
 



  





**Who We're Looking For** 




 We’re looking for a backend-leaning fullstack developer who’s confident across the stack, with a strong focus on building robust, scalable backend systems. You care deeply about clean architecture and performance, enjoy sharing your knowledge, and aren’t afraid to dive into complex challenges hands-on.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Build and maintain frontend and backend components, ensuring performance, security, and usability.
* Collaborate closely with the team to integrate APIs and drive new features from idea to production.
* Play an active role in shaping their development processes and bringing fresh ideas.
* Keep up with industry trends and lead by example in adopting the latest technologies.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Solid experience with TypeScript, Node.js, and MongoDB, with exposure to frameworks like GraphQL and Zustand.
* Working knowledge of frontend technologies (React/React Native) and a collaborative mindset.
* Strong knowledge of performance optimisation, accessibility, and browser compatibility.
* An understanding of UI/UX design principles with a passion for delivering top-notch user experiences.
* Leadership skills and a team-first mentality, with the ability to work independently when needed.



  





**Bonus if You Have** 



* Experience with Java, Kafka, and microservice architecture.
* Familiarity with Jenkins, Kibana, and AWS.



  





**Why Join?** 



* Be part of an international, close-knit team of developers.
* Work in a collaborative environment where innovation and ownership are encouraged.
* Enjoy a hybrid work style with flexibility and occasional in-office collaboration to foster strong team connections.
* Take on meaningful projects where your expertise will have a direct impact on the company’s success.



  





**Sound like you?** 
 We’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 For more information or questions, contact zoe.lepluart@ninox-limited.com.
 



  





*\*\*Please note: Ninox is a recruitment company supporting this client in their hiring process. Your application will be handled with full confidentiality and care.\*\**

title: Staff Engineer, Feature Engineering Platform
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Staff Engineer to join the ML Platform organization and lead the design and evolution of our Feature Engineering Platform. This team owns the foundational layer that connects data and ML workflows, and is central to our mission of making machine learning development seamless, accessible, and production-ready across the company.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer, you’ll shape the architecture and vision of a platform that enables users — from analysts to applied scientists — to explore, engineer, and deploy features with confidence and speed. You’ll work at the intersection of data infrastructure, developer experience, and ML operations, building systems that abstract complexity while ensuring scale, reliability, and strong user ergonomics.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

* Design and drive the architecture for a unified feature engineering experience across batch, streaming, and online contexts.
* Partner closely with UX, product-minded engineers, and ML practitioners to craft high-leverage abstractions.
* Lead cross-cutting initiatives spanning dev environments, notebook integrations, data orchestration, and serving pipelines.
* Embed platform reliability, observability, and data quality into the development lifecycle by default.
* Mentor and uplift a team of engineers across different levels and domains.


 Our humble expectations\*
   

  

* Proven experience designing and scaling complex software, data or, ML platforms.
* Experience in production ML, feature stores, high scalable services.
* Deep expertise in backend systems, APIs, and orchestration — bonus for exposure to Spark, Flink, or streaming data stacks.
* Previous experience in Golang (or compile languages) and Python.
* Track record of shaping developer-facing interfaces or platforms with attention to usability and iteration speed.
* Comfort leading technical strategy and aligning cross-team efforts.


 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We in the Messaging team** 
 own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
   

  

**As a Senior Android Engineer within the messaging team,** 
 you will play a key role in building and enhancing core messaging features integral to our product. You'll work closely with a talented team of Android engineers, writing high-quality, maintainable code while ensuring optimal performance and user experience. Collaboration is at the heart of this role, as you'll partner with various teams and roles across the company to align with shared objectives and contribute to the broader product vision. By following best practices and upholding high engineering standards, you'll help drive the success of our platform, making a meaningful impact while growing in a dynamic and supportive environment.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, designers, and engineers to build & A/B test new features using Agile methodology.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Take responsibility for setting & maintaining high engineering standards and commitment to building products that meet user needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.


**What You Bring In**
* 8+ years of experience in Android development.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product roadmap.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Strong knowledge of version control tools, such as Git.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices, as well as an eye for design.
* Interest in mentoring & coaching others.


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Baronit:**  

At Baronit, we connect brilliant minds to shape the future of technology. As a passionate team of tech experts, we lead with innovation, expertise, and curiosity to help businesses grow and adapt to new opportunities. Our experts blend technical excellence, industry insight, and a strong commitment to delivering exceptional results across sectors such as Automotive, Fintech, Healthcare, Telecom, E-commerce, and more.
  
We are an IT consultancy company based in Gothenburg and are now looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our clients. In this role, you will take on responsibility for a critical traceability system that ensures compliance, quality, and efficiency throughout the software development lifecycle. You will both maintain and evolve existing tools, while also being part of shaping future solutions together with cross-functional teams.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Take ownership of a core traceability tool, ensuring its stability and continuous improvement.
  
Drive new feature development and provide support to users through training and documentation.
  
Contribute to the design of future systems and evaluate new methods and technologies.
  
Play an active role in release processes, ensuring compliance and supporting audits.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Master’s degree or Ph. D. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
  
Proven experience in software/tool development (Python or similar).
  
Knowledge of traceability systems, requirement management, and software process design.
  
Experience in release management workflows (e.g., Git, CI/CD pipelines, version control).
  
Strong programming skills in Python (preferred), C++ or similar languages.
  
Understanding of software architecture and system design principles.
  
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills.
  
Effective communicator with a collaborative mindset and attention to detail.
  
  

**In addition to exciting projects, we also offer:**  

Flexible salary model
  
Technical forums for continuous learning and knowledge sharing
  
Social activities to stay connected and engaged
  
Annual offsite conference for team bonding and inspiration
  
And above all – a great team spirit and a focus on enjoying the journey together

title: IT-support Windows 11
description:
**Introduktion**

För vår kund söker vi en IT-support med fokus på Windows 11. Du blir anställd som konsult hos oss men kommer att jobba hos kunden.

**Bakgrund till behov/projekt:**

I Helsingborgs stad pågår en migrering av ca 10 000 st Win10 klienter till Win11. Ett ökat supportbehov uppstår för att stötta Stadens medarbetare att komma igång med sin nya Win11 klient på ett bra sätt. På Digitaliseringsavdelningen behöver Supportenheten extra resurser för att hantera telefon och fjärrsupporten. Efterfrågan är 3 st Supporttekniker.

**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**

* Ge teknisk support till användare under migreringsprocessen från Windows 10 till Windows 11.
* Hjälpa användare med frågor och problem relaterade till operativsystemet.
* Felsöka och lösa tekniska problem som uppstår i samband med uppgradering, inklusive kompatibilitetsfrågor med program och drivrutiner.
* Hantera beställningar av applikationer och behörighet
* Dokumentera supportärenden, vanliga problem och lösningar för att förbättra migreringsprocessen.
* Kommunicera tydligt och pedagogiskt med användare på alla nivåer för att säkerställa förståelse och trygghet.
* Uppdatera användare om status och eventuellt eskalera ett ärende vidare.
* Ge feedback till projektledare kring eventuella återkommande problem eller förbättringsområden.

**Skall krav:**

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk eller IT-supportfunktion.
* Goda kunskaper i Windows-operativsystem.
* Erfarenhet att arbeta med ärende i ärendehanteringssystem.

**Bör-krav:**

* God förmåga att ge ett professionellt bemötande över telefon och i skrift.

Vi ser framemot din ansökan i form av uppdaterad CV och kompetensspecifika referenser!

title: Medicinsk sekreterare Psykiatrimottagning Affektiva Uddevalla
description:
NU-sjukvården är en del av Västra Götalandsregionen och är ett av Sveriges större länssjukhus. Vi finns på NÄL (Norra Älvsborgs Länssjukhus) i Trollhättan och Uddevalla sjukhus. Sjukhusets upptagningsområde omfattar 280 000 invånare. Tillsammans är vi cirka 5 000 medarbetare som varje dag arbetar för att ge god och säker specialistsjukvård. Vi finns på västkusten och vårt område erbjuder en varierad natur med både hav, berg, skog och sjö.


**Är du medicinsk sekreterare med intresse för vuxenpsykiatri? Vi söker nu en ny medarbetare till vår mottagning.**

**Beskrivning**  

Vi söker en medicinsk sekreterare till ett spännande och omväxlande arbete då vi behöver utöka vårt team.


Vi söker dig som trivs med att ha varierande och stimulerande arbetsuppgifter. I teamen arbetar kuratorer, psykologer, läkare, sjuksköterskor, medicinska sekreterare, arbetsterapeut och teamledare. Med patienten i fokus samarbetar och samverkar vi bland annat med primärvården, kommunen, Försäkringskassa, Arbetsförmedling samt patienternas närstående. Vi är måna om varandra och vår arbetsmiljö.

**Hos oss kommer dina arbetsuppgifter bland annat att bestå av:**

* Medicinsk journaldokumentation i Melior
* Registrering och bokning i patientadministrativa system i Elvis
* Remisshantering
* Telefoniarbete i Telia ACE
* Ärendehantering i SAMSA och Mina vårdkontakter 1177
* Bokning och logistik vid digitala besök
* Posthantering

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som har vårdadministrativ utbildning, du har god IT-kunskap och kan sätta dig in i nya digitala system. Meriterande är om du har vana att arbeta i Melior och Elvis.


Du har förmåga att arbeta självständigt, ta ansvar och organisera ditt arbete samtidigt som du fungerar väl i ett team. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet.

**Övrigt**  

Intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**


Om Västra GötalandsregionenVästra Götalandsregionen finns till för människorna i Västra Götaland. Vi ser till att det finns god hälso- och sjukvård för alla. Vi arbetar för en hållbar utveckling och tillväxt, bra miljö, förbättrad folkhälsa, ett rikt kulturliv och goda kommunikationer i hela Västra Götaland.Västra Götalandsregionen arbetar aktivt för att digitalisera fler arbetssätt. För att vara en del av den digitala omvandlingen har du med dig grundläggande färdigheter och kan använda digitala verktyg och tjänster. Du kan söka information, kommunicera, interagera digitalt, är riskmedveten och har motivation att delta i utvecklingen för att lära nytt.Västra Götalandsregionen krigsplacerar alla tillsvidareanställda medarbetare. Vill du veta mer om Västra Götalandsregionen kan du besöka vår introduktion till nya medarbetare på länken www.vgregion,se/introduktion. Du kan även läsa mer i presentation om Lön, ersättning och förmåner – det här får du som medarbetare i VGR. AnsökanVästra Götalandsregionen ser helst att du registrerar din ansökan via rekryteringssystemet. Om du som sökande har frågor om den utannonserade tjänsten eller av särskilda och speciella skäl inte kan registrera dina uppgifter i ett offentligt system - kontakta kontaktperson för respektive annons. Till bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare:Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag samt andra externa aktörer och försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Västra Götalandsregionen har upphandlade avtal.

title: Analysera och förutsäg produktionsvariationer med hjälp av maskininlärning
description:
*"Att ta sina första steg i karriären ska kännas både spännande och meningsfullt – och precis så vill vi att det ska vara hos oss på Ovako. Som ett av årets Karriärföretag 2025 är vi stolta över att erbjuda en arbetsmiljö där du får växa, utmanas och känna att du gör skillnad. Här möts innovation och människor som tillsammans vill forma framtiden."* – *Phetra Ericsson, EVP Group HR, Com & EHS, Ovako*

**Vad är det som gör att produktionen rullar perfekt ena veckan – och kärvar nästa?**  

För att förbättra industrins effektivitet måste vi förstå vad som faktiskt händer under ytan i våra processer. Det här examensarbetet riktar sig till dig som vill koppla ihop datadriven analys med verkliga utmaningar i produktion. På ett av våra verk finns stora mängder loggad processdata – och du får i uppdrag att ta fram ett generellt angreppssätt för att analysera och förklara skillnaden mellan bra produktionsperioder och produktionsperioder med avvikelser.


Du använder statistik och maskininlärning för att bygga modeller som förutsäger utfallet – och hjälper oss optimera produktionen på riktigt.

**Exjobb för dig som vill använda Python, data och logik för att förstå och förbättra industrin**  

Med hjälp av processdata analyserar du vilka parametrar som skiljer sig mest mellan hög- och lågproduktiva perioder. Du arbetar med statistiska verktyg, skapar prediktiva modeller i Python och testar olika tillvägagångssätt för att identifiera vad som verkligen gör skillnad. Målet är att skapa ett användbart verktyg för beslutsfattare – och konkreta rekommendationer för förbättring.

**Varför ska du välja Ovako?**  

För att du får fördjupa dig i verkliga data, skarpa problem och lösningar som gör skillnad i vår dagliga produktion. Hos oss finns både teknikutmaningar och viljan att utvecklas tillsammans – och du får friheten att testa idéer i en miljö som uppmuntrar nyfikenhet och innovation.

**Är det här du?**  

Vi tror att du:

* Läser en utbildning inom datateknik, industriell ekonomi, maskinteknik eller liknande.
* Har erfarenhet av dataanalys och programmering i Python.
* Gillar att lösa komplexa problem med strukturerat angreppssätt.
* Är analytisk, initiativtagande och vill omsätta teori i praktik.

**Information och villkor**

**Ersättning och förmåner**  

Att göra exjobb hos Ovako innebär att få arbeta mitt i hjärtat av en produktion där teknik, innovation och hållbarhet går hand i hand. Här finns både en stolt historia och en stark vilja att ständigt förbättra – och just där kommer du in i bilden.  

Vi vet att ett exjobb är en viktig del av din utbildning – och vi tar det på allvar. Därför erbjuder vi ersättning per högskolepoäng, möjligheter till boende under perioden och stöd med resor till och från våra anläggningar. Hos oss ska du kunna fokusera fullt ut på uppdraget.

**Rekryteringsprocessen**  

Urval sker löpande. Under processen får du möjlighet att träffa handledare, relevanta chefer och andra nyckelpersoner. Processen innehåller även intervjuer, tester och referenstagning.


Om Ovako På Ovako specialiserar vi oss på rent, högkvalitativt specialstål, skräddarsydda efter behoven hos våra kunder inom lager, transport och tillverkningssektorer. Vårt högkvalitativa stål, baserat på 97% återvunnet stål, säkerställer lätta och tåliga produkter samt möjliggör mer hållbara och miljövänliga lösningar. Med 2600 dedikerade medarbetare och en global närvaro som sträcker sig över 30 länder samt cirka 1,1 miljarder euro i omsättning står Ovako, ett dotterbolag till Sanyo Special Steel och en stolt medlem av Nippon Steel Corporation, i framkant av stålindustrin. Vårt syfte är tydligt: Tillsammans skapar vi stål för ett hållbart samhälle. Upptäck mer om våra innovativa lösningar på www.ovako.com, www.sanyo-steel.co.jp och www.nipponsteel.com.

title: Enhetschefer till sektionen för drift och teknikutveckling
description:
På Migrationsverket arbetar vi med en av vår tids stora samhällsfrågor – migrationen. Totalt är vi cirka 6 000 personer här, och vi har ett ovanligt viktigt jobb!

*Migrationsverket finns för människor som söker skydd i Sverige och för dem som vill arbeta, studera eller bo här. Detta gör vi inom asylrättens och den reglerade invandringens gränser. Vi tar emot ansökningar, prövar dem och fattar beslut om vilka som har rätt att komma hit eller stanna här, och vilka som måste lämna landet. I vårt arbete vägleds vi av våra värdeord mod, empati och tydlighet. Myndigheten är också inne i ett digitaliseringsarbete som innebär en förändring av processer och arbetssätt inom hela myndigheten med fokus på innovativa digitala lösningar, automatisering och livscykelhantering, och agila arbetssätt.*

**Om oss:**


Migrationsverket är mitt i en digitaliseringsresa. Detta innebär att gamla system ska avvecklas, nya ska utvecklas och implementeras samtidigt som vi måste hålla gamla system igång med hög driftsäkerhet. Det innebär också att vårt arbetssätt och kultur förändras. Migrationsverket befinner sig i en period av stora förändringar på många plan vi har höga krav från omvärlden på vår leverans. Vi prövar nya arbetssätt och tekniker hela tiden och utmanar gamla sanningar.


Migrationsverket satsar på sin digitaliseringsverksamhet och söker flera enhetschefer som vill vara en del av vår resa. De områden som vi behöver utöka är inom drift och teknikutveckling, vi söker flera enhetschefer för team som jobbar med helhetsansvar för central it-infrastruktur och plattformar.

**Om rollen som enhetschef drift och teknikutveckling**


I rollen som enhetschef leder du och coachar högt tekniskt kompetenta medarbetare som jobbar med utveckling, underhåll och drift av centrala delar inom it-infrastrukturen. Du jobbar med rekrytering och kompetensplanering inom din enhet. Verksamhetsutveckling och ständiga förbättringar av våra processer och verktyg ingår också som en naturlig del. Du behöver vara trygg i ditt ledarskap med förmåga att skapa förutsättningar för dina medarbetare att växa i sina roller och att skapa ett klimat som inspirerar till arbetsglädje och effektivitet. Som chef har du ett helhetsperspektiv och agerar med personlig mognad och prestigelöshet i samspelet med medarbetare, chefskollegor, styrgrupper och användare.


Som enhetschef ansvarar du för kompetensutveckling, planering, budget och rekrytering för din enhet. Du ansvarar även för att skapa rätt förutsättningar och en bra arbetsmiljö för dina team. Du vet att du har lyckats när teamen levererar nytta till verksamheten vilket i förlängningen bland annat ska leda till att handläggningstiden för våra sökande sjunker, eller när fler sökande får svar på sina frågor snabbare.


Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med projektledare, produktägare, it-tekniker, it-specialister, enhetschefer, sektionschefer, kansli, controllers, etc. Dina kontaktytor är många och det nätverk som du kommer att bygga upp är stort.

**Du som söker har**

* Akademisk utbildning inom it/datavetenskap eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som relevant för befattningen
* Flerårig erfarenhet inom it-infrastruktur och it-drift inom större verksamhet
* Flerårig erfarenhet från ledande roller inom it-infrastruktur med ansvar för att utveckla medarbetare och verksamhet
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* God kunskap om förändringsledning
* Svenskt medborgarskap

**Det är meriterande om du har**

* Dokumenterad chef-/ledarskapsutbildning
* Kunskap om arbetssätt och metoder inom it (Produktstyrning, ITIL, Agila metoder och DevOps)

*Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras.* ***Utifrån detta ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap. Anställningen förutsätter en godkänd säkerhetsprövning.***

**Upplysningar**


Placeringsort: Norrköping


Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid


Tjänsten: Tillsvidareanställning


Tillträde: Snarast enligt överenskommelse


Förmåner: Migrationsverket erbjuder en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid och goda möjligheter till hemarbete. Friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimme samt ersättning upp till 90 % av lönen vid föräldraledighet.

**Vill du veta mer**


Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef, Aldin Karic via e-post: aldin.karic@migrationsverket.se eller telefon: 010-4856910.

**Ansökan**


Välkommen med dina ansökningshandlingar senast **den 19 september 2025.** Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.

title: IT-specialist applikation - Eskilstuna
description:
**Vi söker nu en IT-specialist inom applikation till vår växande IT-enhet! Drömmer du om att kombinera teknik och samhällsnytta? Vill du dessutom jobba med ett erfaret gäng som har roligt på jobbet? Vill du vara med där det händer? Välkommen med din ansökan!**



Vi är en av Sveriges största fastighetsägare och experter inom fortifikation, det vill säga skydds- och anläggningsteknik. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att bidra till ökad försvarsförmåga för ett tryggt och fritt Sverige. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö där ditt arbete gör verklig skillnad för Sveriges trygghet och framtid.


**Din vardag – bidra till vår utveckling med fokus teknik**
-----------------------------------------------------------



IT-enheten består idag av 44 personer, och planerar för ytterligare utökning. Vi arbetar med såväl administrativa IT-miljöer som med säkerhetsskyddsklassade, där utveckling och engagemang är viktigt för oss. Vi arbetar ständigt med vår kompetensutveckling och vi är måna om att alla tar del av olika utbildningsinsatser.



I rollen som IT-specialist inom appliktion ansvarar du för djup teknisk och funktionell kunskap om ett eller flera system/applikationer inom ett eller flera förvaltningsobjekt. Rollen bidrar till att säkerställa stabil drift, effektivt stöd till verksamheten, samt att förändringar och vidareutveckling sker med god kvalitet och enligt fastställda rutiner. Dina huvudsakligar arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:


* Förvalta och optimera en eller flera applikationer/system ur ett tekniskt och användarperspektiv.
* Agera tekniskt stöd till förvaltningsledare, förvaltningsledare IT och verksamhetsrepresentanter.
* Delta i felsökning och incidenthantering tillsammans med drift- och supportorganisationer.
* Delta i eller leda tekniska analyser, tester, uppgraderingar och implementationer.
* Ta fram teknisk dokumentation, driftdokumentation och användarstöd.
* Agera som expertkontakt gentemot leverantörer vid t.ex. uppgraderingar eller fel.
* Bevaka och föreslå förbättringar inom applikationsområdet t.ex. automation, prestanda och säkerhet.

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------



Vi söker dig som har högskole- eller universitesutbildning med IT-inriktning, systemvetenskap eller annan utbildning som vi bedömer likvärdig. Du ska ha flerårig erfarenhet av arbete med IT-applikationer och du ska ha flerårig erfarenhet av att dokumentera tekniska lösningar. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift samt goda kunskaper i engelska. Du har också god administrativ förmåga. Körkort B samt svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.



 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:


* IT-förvaltning och utveckling enligt etablerade modeller som pm³, ITIL eller liknande
* Arbetat med behovsanalyser och processer i statlig myndighet.
* Hantera ärendeflöden och designa formulär.
* Arbetat i applikationen Easit GO.
* Arbetat i statlig myndighet inom IT.


Dina personliga egenskaper är mycket viktiga för oss och vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet där en viktig del är att du är säkerhetsmedveten. Som person tycker du om att arbeta enligt en tydlig process, organiserar och planerar ditt arbete väl. Du slutför det som påbörjats och håller deadlines.Du är intresserad av ditt område och du omvärldsbevakar och trendspanar. Du är duktig på att snabbt finna lösningar på uppkomna problem. När det mycket att göra hanterar du press på ett konstruktivt sätt.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
------------------------



Tillsammans med cirka 1300 kollegor på Fortifikationsverket runt om i landet jobbar du med ett unikt fastighetsbestånd för att stärka totalförsvaret i Sverige. Vi är stolta över det samhällsviktiga uppdrag vi har där vi genom att äga, utveckla och förvalta fastigheter för totalförsvaret bidrar till ett tryggt och fritt Sverige. Våra arbetsuppgifter är omväxlande, spännande och utmanande och kräver sin kompetens. Vi arbetar med basen i den statliga värdegrunden och vi eftersträvar jämn könsfördelning. Lika rättigheter och möjligheter är viktigt för oss.



Här får du goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och vi jobbar för att du ska kunna ha en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid.


**Om anställningen**
--------------------



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med möjlighet till provanställning. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, eftersom anställningar vid Fortifikationsverket är säkerhetsklassade. Det innebär att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter; har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringsspecialist som finns namngiven så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan. Som tillsvidareanställd kommer du att krigsplaceras.



Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev **senast den 21 september 2025**. Vid ansökan kommer dina personuppgifter behandlas enligt dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR). Din ansökan är en offentlig handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.


**Frågor kring tjänsten?**
--------------------------



Välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Ronny Berggren 010-44 45 592, biträdande IT-chef Mikael Dahlberg 010-44 44 118 eller rekryteringsspecialist Fredrik Dyrvik 010-44 45 647. Det går även bra att kontakta våra fackliga representanter: Eric Bergman, Ledarna, Tommy Eriksson, SEKO, Karin Alm, SACO, de nås via vår växel, tfn 010-44 44 000.



Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Backend Engineer, Health tech
description:
**Join us in shaping better Healthcare!**


Platform24 is on a mission to unlock the potential of healthcare by creating a smooth and accessible healthcare where patients and caregivers are empowered by the most intelligent technology available.


Joining our team as a Backend Engineer means playing a key role in one of Europe's most innovative health-tech companies, with the largest market adoption in the Nordics. You will have a significant impact and contribute to shaping the future of healthcare. Combining medical expertise with technology crafted by our engineers, we significantly improve healthcare quality and efficiency on a major scale.


Our diverse team, consisting of frontend and backend engineers, an interaction designer, a product manager, and an engineering manager, collaborates closely to achieve these objectives.


You and your team will have end-to-end ownership of your area of Platform24's solutions, which encompasses everything from the UI to backend services and DevOps.


As a Senior Backend Engineer on the team, you'll have a critical role in shaping our innovative product. You will be at the forefront of designing, building, and implementing new features, contributing to architecture discussions, technology choices, and communicating technical topics to non-technical stakeholders. Your expertise will be crucial in enhancing our existing tech stack, which includes Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, Kubernetes, Quarkus, and more...

**Responsibilities of this role include...**

* Design, build, test, and deploy software as needed
* Support applications running in all environments
* Build and maintain code documentation and automated test suites
* Participate in improving ways of working in the team, engineering, and the company as a whole
* Troubleshoot and debug software
* Work with requirements stakeholders to design well-crafted solutions that meet expectations.
* Participate in an on-call rotation to respond to production issues
* Ensure that the code health of the software is on a level where the team can work efficiently
* Participate in knowledge spreading within engineering
* Teach and coach colleagues when appropriate
* Being a role model of values and company culture


To succeed in this role, you will need...You're a team player who thrives in a cooperative environment. You're an experienced Java developer, highly skilled in Spring Boot and Quarkus. Your expertise in designing APIs and building microservices, and your knowledge of relational database design, MySQL, and JPA/Hibernate, will be invaluable in our mission to make healthcare better.

**What we offer:**

* Working collaboratively with diverse teams
* Working in a structured and systematic way
* Language learning courses
* Friendly environment, flexible work hours, and promote work-life balance

**Being part of the P24 Team:**


At Platform24, we understand that everyone has unique needs when it comes to organizing their lives. That's why we prioritize flexible working hours to promote work-life balance for all. Additionally, we host Demo & Beers sessions every other week, providing a platform to share our achievements (beers optional!). We prioritize personal growth and offer a range of benefits, including the opportunity to dedicate five workdays a year to volunteer work. Moreover, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with intelligent, friendly, and talented colleagues from all over the world.  

  

**Hear one of our teams tell you about the inner workings at Platform24:**

**Apply:**


If you believe we're the right workplace for you and you're the right fit for us, submit your application today! We conduct ongoing interviews, so we encourage you to apply soon..


We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.


This role is a full-time employment with Platform24. We do not offer contractor and/or B2B types of engagements.

title: IT-specialist
description:
**Rollen:**  

Du har en bred erfarenhet inom IT-infrastrukturområdet från större IT-miljöer. Du är van vid att arbeta i Microsoft-miljö och har grundläggande kunskaper om virtualisering, nätverk och hårdvara. Du kommer arbeta med dagligdrift och stötta
  

vår drift och övervakning samt arbeta med våra förvaltningar.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Är du en Data Engineer som älskar att omvandla rådata till riktigt värde?


Perfekt!


Vi söker dig som gillar att lösa kluriga problem, bygga smarta datapipelines och samarbeta med andra.  

Om du är social, nyfiken och öppen är det ett stort plus.  

Har du erfarenhet av Databricks? Ännu bättre!  

  



**ERFARENHET**

* 3+ års erfarenhet av data engineering eller systemutveckling
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Databricks, Spark eller liknande plattformar är ett

️ **Logikfabriken** är ett konsultbolag av och för talangfulla, engagerade och roliga personer inom tech.


Vår ambition är att bli Sveriges mest inspirerande arbetsgivare.


Tillsammans formar vi bolaget, skapar möjligheter och driver utvecklingen framåt.
