title: Product Manager – MACH Control Platform for Grid and Power Quality Solutions & Service
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Hitachi Energy is a pioneering technology leader helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable, and modern energy for all. We power homes, industries, and infrastructure, enabling the transition to a carbon-neutral future. Join a team that values diversity, collaboration, and innovation.

  

MACH (**M**odular **A**dvanced **C**ontrol for **H**VDC and SVC) is the industry leading state-of-the-art control platform from Hitachi Energy for designing control and protection solutions for power electronics systems that are key for energy transition and evolving power grids of the future. The MACH platform is integral to the power electronics based systems like HVDC and STATCOMs solutions from Hitachi Energy’s Grid Integration business unit.


We are seeking a Product Manager – MACH Control Platform for Grid & Power Quality Solutions and Service (GPQSS) to join our MACH Product Management team, with a dedicated focus on product management aspects of MACH Control Platform for High Power and Medium Power GPQSS applications.


You will be responsible for managing the MACH product portfolio lifecycle, ensuring strategic alignment between MACH and GPQSS, and driving innovation and operational excellence across cross-functional teams.

  

This role also serves as the single point of contact between MACH and GPQSS organizations for all product management topics related to the MACH platform.

  

The position is primarily based in Ludvika/Västerås, Sweden, but Kraków, Poland, could also be considered.

 **How you’ll make an impact**

* Align strategic product decisions between MACH and GPQSS across all product lines and business segments.
* Oversee MACH R&D projects to ensure alignment with GPQSS product management priorities; participate in governance forums.
* Review and approve change requests for MACH R&D projects targeted at GPQSS and redistribute product management topics within MACH as needed and represent GPQSS business views in internal MACH governance forums.
* Analyze market segments, customer needs, competitor offerings and competitiveness to guide product strategy. Define and maintain product and solution roadmaps, ensuring consistency and alignment with business needs.
* Own and maintain MACH market/customer requirements and contribute to solution and system requirements definition as needed, especially requirements related to GPQSS applications.
* Drive MACH lifecycle management topics, product introductions, phase-outs, and portfolio optimization towards GPQSS.
* Define and maintain the MACH business model towards GPQSS and R&D funding strategy.
* Drive cross functional collaboration between the broader MACH and GPQSS stakeholders toward a one team spirit.

 **Your background**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering or related field.
* Postgraduate qualification in Marketing, Strategy, or Business (e.g., MBA) is a plus.
* 5+ years of experience in product management, preferably in power electronics or control systems.
* Leadership, people and change management experience preferred and proven ability to lead cross-functional and cross-cultural teams across geographies.
* Strong understanding of industrial hardware/software development and lifecycle management and experience in control and protection solutions for Power Electronics based systems (Grid and Power Quality applications or HVDC) will be preferred but not mandatory.
* Candidates with very strong domain knowledge and demonstrated leadership skills may be considered, even with limited prior product management experience.
* Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and decision-making skills and strong interpersonal and communication skills with a collaborative mindset.
* Proficient in business professional English.

 **What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

 **More about us**


We are looking for a variety of people with the right mindset to join our team so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis and the position can be filled with short notice.


Recruiting manager Bhagwat Gahane, bhagwat.gahane@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Mikael Hjort, + 46 107 38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107 38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Christian.falevik@hotmail.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Operations Planner for Components
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**


As an Operations Planner at Hitachi, you will play a key role in ensuring efficient production planning, supply chain coordination, and workflow optimization. You will work closely with manufacturing, procurement, and logistics teams to maintain seamless operations while meeting customer demands and quality standards.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Develop and manage operational schedules to optimize resource utilization and timely delivery of our products.
* Coordinate with production logistics and supply chain teams to meet business objectives.
* Monitor workflow efficiency and identify areas for improvement.
* Analyze operational data to forecast demand and adjust planning accordingly.
* Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to align operations with business goals.
* Handle problems- solving and crisis management in case of operational disruptions.

**Your background**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in production planning, logistics, or supply chain management.
* Proficiency in planning and scheduling software (e.g., SAP, ERP, Power BI systems)
* Excellent communication and coordination abilities.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of manufacturing processes and materials is a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

title: Factory System Test Lead
description:
**Description**


At Hitachi Energy, we are a leading innovator in HVDC installations, dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions and services to our clients worldwide. With a presence in over 200+ countries, our diverse team of professionals is committed to excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We are proud of our rich history of success and our forward-looking approach that keeps us at the forefront of this industry.


We are now seeking a dynamic and driven Factory System Test Lead to join our professional team. If you are passionate about HVDC technology, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and eager to make a significant impact, we want to hear from you!


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements.

**Your responsibilities**

* Responsible for developing test strategies
* Manage the planning and execution of testing activities
* You will perform quality control and assurance
* You will have team management
* You will ensure compliance and standards
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

**Your background**

* A bachelor's degree in STEM fields is preferrable
* You have knowledge of software tools and programming languages used in control systems PLC, SCADA, DCS
* It is an advantage if you have understanding of protection principles, relay coordination, and fault analysis in HVDC systems or equivalents
* You have excellent verbal communication skills that will allow you to report effectively and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders
* Proficient in both English and Swedish, with speaking and writing skills in both languages

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement.
* Flexible working time.
* Health care and wellness allowance.
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally.
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase.
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development.
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden.
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave.
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks.
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role.

**More about us**

title: Claim Lab Engineer
description:
**Claim Lab Engineer**
======================

Location:
Landskrona, M, SE
Work Arrangement: Onsite
At SWEP, we believe our future rest on give more energy than we take – to our planet and to our people.  

  

As the world´s leading supplier of efficient heat transfer technology, we are driving the conversion to sustainable energy usage in heat transfer. We are dedicated to constantly creating more from less energy, material, and space.  

For us at SWEP, it's more than just a job, it´s a commitment to making a difference and an impact by finding new ways to make energy last longer – globally and locally. We are striving for record-breaking growth and are looking for individuals who think like entrepreneurs, have an open mind, care about the environment, and want to inspire and be inspired. Come and join us!

**Claim Lab Engineer**


**Based in Landskrona**

  


**What you will do**



We are now looking for a Claim Lab Engineer to our production site in Landskrona. In this role, you will investigate, analyze and document customer claims and internal nonconformities. You will also perform product and process development related investigations. You will get the opportunity to deliver advanced support and expertise within your area of competence and work in close cooperation with colleagues from Sales, R&D and other SWEP plants.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Investigate field failure claims from Global market.
* Upon request, investigate line failure claims from all SWEP plants and perform internal investigations from our plants and as well as from other functions.
* Coordinate advanced external investigations including definition of scope.
* Work with engineering, production or other functions to determine root cause of failure and suggest corrective actions.
* Write investigation reports.
* Develop analysis methods to improve the claim lab’s competence, capacity and overal performance.

  


**Your background**



We believe you have a background within mechanical engineering or equivalent work experience, including welding, forklift and overhead crane certificates. You have a solid BPHE knowledge, both about the product (application and systems, design, material, metallurgy, corrosion, fatigue) and the manufacturing process. Furthermore, you are confident in using software systems as MS office and other relevant business systems. You also need to be fluent in English since you will have a lot of global contacts and write investigation reports in English.

  


**Who you are**



We are looking for an open and communicative person who thrives in stepping out of their comfort zone. You drive your work independently towards the targets, with the best solution for the customer in mind. We also expect you to be curious and willing to listen to complex challenges. To be successful in this role, you need to have an analytical and strategic mindset.

  


***For more information****,* please contact Pavol Cizmar, Quality & EHS Director*,* at +421 911 015 700 or by mail: pavol.cizmar@swepgroup.com

  


***Sounds interesting?***Do not hesitate - apply today! You are welcome with your application and CV in English, not later than **14 September 2025.**

  

We consider several job-related, non-discriminatory factors when determining the pay rate for a position, including, but not limited to, the position’s responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, a candidate’s education/training, the position’s location, and the key skills needed for the position. Pay is one of the Total Rewards that we provide to compensate and recognize employees for their work



We are a growing company and a part of the Dover Corporation family. We are dedicated to supporting our customers with the optimal solutions and we believe in close, rewarding partnerships. We are represented in more than 50 countries and have production facilities in Sweden, USA, Slovakia, China and Malaysia.



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.

  

  

**Job Segment:** Thermal Engineering, Metallurgy, Sustainability, Mechanical Engineer, Manufacturing Engineer, Engineering, Manufacturing, Energy

title: Senior Production Quality Specialist
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


Quality Manager  

Are you passionate about driving quality to the next level? In this role, you will play a key part in shaping and deploying our Quality strategy across the organization. You’ll help strengthen our quality culture, enhance systems and tools, and ensure we not only meet but exceed customer expectations – all while enabling sustainable and reliable operations. Your expertise will be central in balancing prevention, continuous improvement, robust root cause analysis, and swift, lasting solutions to challenges.

**Your role and responsibilities**  

* Take full ownership of the quality KPI framework – from defining targets and analyzing results to identifying and addressing deviations.
* Approve deviations for both products and processes with a focus on maintaining high standards in production.
* Act as the "voice of quality" throughout the organization.
* Develop, implement, and continuously refine production quality standards to secure consistent and outstanding product and process performance.
* Conduct regular quality audits to ensure compliance with both internal and external requirements.
* Use quality data and insights to spot trends, prevent issues, and drive ongoing improvement initiatives.
**Qualifications for the role**  

• Engineering degree, Production, Quality, or similar.• Several years of hands-on experience working within quality and continuous improvements.  

* Solid knowledge of quality methodologies.
* Lean Six Sigma expertise, preferably with a Green Belt certification.
* A collaborative, solution-oriented mindset paired with excellent communication skills, both written and verbal in Swedish and English.
* Knowledge in both electronics and mechanics.
* Strong analytical and advanced problem-solving abilities with a proven track record of resolving complex quality challenges.
* Proficiency in quality management systems, software, and tools.
**Why ABB?**


We empower you to take the lead, share bold ideas, and shape real outcomes. You’ll grow through hands-on experience, mentorship, and learning that fits your goals. Here, your work doesn’t just matter, it moves things forward. Guide the future. This is where innovation accelerates, industries are reimagined, and your impact powers the world ahead. Run What Runs the World.

 **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Ulf Carlqvist, +46 72-544 91 47, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16; Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Irma Leijon, +46 724 61 23 14.


We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is September 28. The interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process. Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Operations Planner for Components
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0102117
**Date Posted:**

2025-08-26
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB

Customer Service & Contact Center Operations

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**

As an Operations Planner at Hitachi, you will play a key role in ensuring efficient production planning, supply chain coordination, and workflow optimization. You will work closely with manufacturing, procurement, and logistics teams to maintain seamless operations while meeting customer demands and quality standards.


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Develop and manage operational schedules to optimize resource utilization and timely delivery of our products.
* Coordinate with production logistics and supply chain teams to meet business objectives.
* Monitor workflow efficiency and identify areas for improvement.
* Analyze operational data to forecast demand and adjust planning accordingly.
* Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to align operations with business goals.
* Handle problems- solving and crisis management in case of operational disruptions.

**Your background**

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience in production planning, logistics, or supply chain management.
* Proficiency in planning and scheduling software (e.g., SAP, ERP, Power BI systems)
* Excellent communication and coordination abilities.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of manufacturing processes and materials is a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**

title: Design Engineer
description:
**Role:** Design Engineer**Location:** Kista, Stockholm, Sweden**Contract type:** full time, permanent contract **About Marioff**
For four decades, Marioff has been driven by the challenge of keeping people and businesses safe. Today, we are the global leader in high-pressure water mist fire protection with our HI-FOG system, setting new standards and pushing the fire protection industry forward. Rooted in Nordic innovation and delivering globally, Marioff is home to those who approach challenges with an innovative mindset, persistence, and an unwavering commitment to quality. We believe that delivering peace of mind and reliability to our customers requires empowering diverse teams to collaborate towards common success, creating a lasting impact.  

At Marioff, more than 500 motivated professionals work across the globe. As a truly global company, we value the diversity of roles and skills within our team, with colleagues from nearly 30 nationalities collaborating towards a common goal.  

With our head office in Vantaa and our factory in Kerava, Finland, we have a global reach with subsidiaries in France, Germany, Italy, North America, Spain, Sweden, the United Kingdom, Poland and China.  

**Summary**
We are currently looking for a **Design Engineer** to strengthen our team, based in Stockholm. In this role you would be supporting the design of our fire suppression systems, performing hydraulic calculations, also participating in site surveys and communicating with our customers.  

  

**Requirements**
To be successful in this role, you must have:  

* Higher education suitable for the task (Design, CAD, Mechanical, Building Services, Civil, Construction or Electrical Engineering)
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities needed to handle frequent discussions with the customers
* Fluent Swedish and English skills, both spoken and written
* ~2 years of work experience with AutoCAD 2D/3D (preferred) or other relevant CAD software
* Strong calculation and costing abilities
* Ability to work independently and effectively in a team, analytical skills and attention to detail

  

Although not necessary, it would be a great advantage:  

* Experience/knowledge with Revit 3D design software
* Experience with HVAC, fire protection system/sprinkler design, involvement with plumbing/piping
* Knowledge/practical experience with Hydraulic systems or Electricity/Electrical products

 **Responsibilities:**  

In the role of **Design Engineer**, you focus on CAD to design and construct layout solutions of Marioff's sprinkler systems and associated detection systems. You are already involved in the sales phase together with the responsible salespeople by acting as an expert regarding design of the product. After that, you are responsible for designing solutions and layouts in AutoCAD and Revit as well as Marioff's internal tools. You are involved throughout the project until the project is completed at the customer's premises. Marioff works on several different projects in real estate and in the industrial sector.
You will work closely with other design engineers and project managers, you would report directly to the Operations Manager, who’s based in the office in Kista. You will also work with fitters and service technicians who will work with the systems you design. The position involves some travel around Sweden. **Benefits**
We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.* Competitive compensation
* Occupational health care service
* Marioff Employee Milestones
* An opportunity to work in a company with high technology products
* A dynamic and internationally oriented work environment

**Our commitment to you**
We offer you a dynamic and international work environment in a company with high technology products, a strong growth strategy and people who are passionate about fire safety. At Marioff we value diversity in all its forms and we believe that it is our excellent, highly skilled people who make success, competitive excellence and innovation happen. Join us to our mission to protect people, property and business continuity! **Apply Now!**

title: E/E Engineer High Voltage & Battery
description:
The Koenigsegg R&D team is a small, agile hub of highly talented individuals, where the sum is greater than the parts. Koenigsegg is committed to hiring and developing top talent from across the world for any given discipline. Our world-class team operates with a non-conventional, ‘Lean Development’ philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You will be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, and to innovate.


For this role we are looking for someone with a genuine passion for engineering the best vehicles in the world. You will be working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company, leading the way in the hypercar business. You’ll work alongside accomplished, world-renowned engineers on perhaps the most exciting automotive programs in existence today.


**Responsibilities**


+ Capturing requirements and supporting design, testing, and prototyping activities for high-voltage components such as HV battery, OBC, DC/DC converter, and other HV related systems.
+ Supporting prototyping, test and validation activities at the component, system, or vehicle level.
+ Working closely with cross functional members to support activities such as software development, mechanical packaging, harness design and homologation.

Skills & Requirements


**Minimum Qualifications**


* PCB design experience, preferably on Altium Designer
* Experience in troubleshooting E/E systems and EMI
* Experience in component selection
* Fundamental knowledge on high-voltage systems
* Understanding of prototyping, production technologies, and validation procedures
* R&D Experience in development for production, ideally with cutting edge technologies
* Minimum 3+ years, preferably 5+ years of relevant experience
* Professional level of English along with good communication skills
* Engineering degree within relevant field


**Meritorious Qualifications**


* Design experience on high-voltage systems for automotive
* Experience in battery management system and PDU/BDU development
* Hands-on experience with handling high-voltage systems and li-ion batteries
* Knowledge of functions and safety aspects of li-ion battery packs and battery management systems
* Hands-on experience with battery testing equipment


Great Place to Work


Opportunity to impact a growing company


Work alongside world-class talent


Flexible work schedules + Culture of collaboration


Long track record of success and profitability


Engaging and sharing work environment


Quick decision making, flat hierarchy


About the company


Koenigsegg is most known for building some of the fastest cars in the world; with almost all of our megacar technologies that are patented and made in-house by our almost 500 world-class technicians, engineers, sourcing experts, production craftsmen, and communicators.


What we’ve created is a unique proving ground of engineering creativity that makes use of our breakthrough megacar development and legacy to push the boundaries of sustainable mobility technology.



So, what’s next?


We are on a universe-denting mission to develop the next generation of breakthrough tech and products. We are looking for outstanding, impactful, and authentic individuals to grow with us. Our ambitions are inspiring but will push the limits of what is possible – requiring one to work efficiently amid our cross-functional teams to execute at high-quality levels.


**The goal is clear: innovate and transform.**

title: Research engineer
description:
This is a career-changing opportunity to work alongside world-class engineers and scientists on a mission to reimagine what machines can do. You’ll help us build the digital nervous system of intelligent agents - not by refining existing tools, but by inventing new systems entirely.
  
Our software stack is built from scratch in C/C++. We don’t use common ML frameworks - we build what we need. This is deep, interdisciplinary, and often exploratory work. You’ll translate theory, papers, and biological hypotheses into robust, real-time systems that can be deployed on various industrial and internal use-cases.
  
  

What You’ll Do Translate neuroscience ideas and research into performant, testable code
  
Design and run experiments to test model behaviour and learning dynamics
  
Use your reasoning, programming and hardware skills to mature and validate the AI models in relevant environments.
  
Work hands-on with system architecture, custom tooling, and low-level logic
  
Collaborate with peers across neuroscience, robotics, and software engineering
  
  

What You Bring Passion for exploring intelligence from first principles
  
Research mind-set that pushes the boundaries
  
Proficiency in C/C++ (or similar languages) and a systems-level mindset
  
Proven ability to build and debug complex software
  
Excitement to join a team tackling some of the hardest problems of our time
  
  

Bonus Signals Background in physics, computational neuroscience, mathematics, robotics or control theory
  
Experience in real-time systems, robotics, or simulation
  
  

Who You Are Mission-driven and positive. Even in the face of complexity
  
Curious, self-motivated, and proactive about solving hard problems
  
An empathetic collaborator who values clarity and rigor
  
Comfortable working across disciplines, independently and in teams

title: Senior Research Engineer
description:
This is a career-changing opportunity to work alongside world-class engineers and scientists on a mission to reimagine what machines can do. You’ll help us build the digital nervous system of intelligent agents - not by refining existing tools, but by inventing new systems entirely.
  
Our software stack is built from scratch in C/C++. We don’t use common ML frameworks- we build what we need. This is deep, interdisciplinary, and often exploratory work. As a Research engineer within, you will work closely with the founders in developing and testing the emerging capabilities of our unique general-purpose AI models.
  
  

What You’ll Do Translate neuroscience ideas and research into performant, testable code
  
Use your research and development skills to make sure the AI models perform the way they should and fit into real-world use-cases.
  
Use your reasoning, programming and hardware skills to mature and validate the AI models in relevant environments.
  
Collaborate with peers across neuroscience, robotics, and software engineering
  
  

What You Bring Passion for exploring intelligence from first principles
  
Research mind-set that pushes the boundaries
  
Experience in analysing AI models
  
Experience in coding (C\C++) and product development
  
Ability to design, implement, and test in a fast-paced environment

With a presence in over 200+ countries, our diverse team of professionals is committed to excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We are proud of our rich history of success and our forward-looking approach that keeps us at the forefront of this industry.

title: Experienced Electronics Engineer with RF background to our R&D site in Stockholm
description:
Job Title
Experienced Electronics Engineer with RF background to our R&D site in Stockholm
Job Description*At Axis, we’ve always been about pushing the boundaries in pursuit of innovating for a smarter, safer world. We do this by developing IP-based products and innovations for security and video surveillance. After a successful start last spring with the opening of our new Stockholm office, we are excited to expand our team. We’re looking for an Electronics Engineer to help us develop more network tech innovations. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to join us at the forefront of our new and expanding site!*
Who is your future team?  

Working together in a team, you will play a crucial role in expanding our current product portfolio with wireless technologies for our next generation of products.
You will be collaborating with co-workers from different disciplines, such as mechanical design, software, production testing and more.
Our most important asset is our ability to cooperate. If you are a person that likes to get involved, make a difference, and nudge the world a little bit in the right direction, you will feel at home with us.
What You’ll Do as an Electronics Engineer?  

As an Electronics Engineer at Axis, you will have the main responsibility for the design, testing, and certification of the electronics in our projects. Your daily work will include system design, schematics, soldering, component selection, electronic testing, and certification. We develop our products from start to finish and want you to be involved in the entire process.
You will work closely with PCB CAD, electronics, software, and mechanical engineers to create optimal hardware designs and high-quality products. Additionally, you will collaborate with the Operations department, assisting in production start-up and optimization, and manage contacts with component distributors, subcontractors, and manufacturers.
Who are you?  

We expect you to have at least a Bachelor’s degree in engineering. You should have a strong understanding of system-level design combined with knowledge of RF technologies.
You are also expected to have a good understanding of other engineering areas and the ability to collaborate effectively with software and mechanical design teams.
What Axis has to offer  

We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.
This is a unique opportunity to be part of building our new R&D office in central Stockholm. You’ll enjoy the advantages of working at a small, agile site while also being part of a successful organization that is already the world leader in network video.
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We process applications continuously, so do not hesitate to submit your application today!
If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact the recruiting manager, Johan Nylander at Johan.Nylander@axis.com
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-09-23*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: TP Stockholm is looking for an On-site System Engineer
description:
Teleperformance are looking for an On-site System Engineer based at our office in Solna, Stockholm.

**Job description**


The On-site System Engineer will provide technical support and user administration within Teleperformance Nordic IT.


Working with applications/systems to undertake analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of problems, which may range from straightforward to more complicated technical issues. There is also a range of administration duties within this role.


Coverage includes the TP sites in the Nordic region as well as remote users and users at client’s offices and home workers.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Serve as the first point of contact for IT incidents and service requests from on-site staff.
* Provide technical support across hardware, software, networks, and user accounts.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to laptops, desktops, mobile devices, printers, and peripherals.
* Install, configure, and maintain workstations and IT equipment.
* Manage user account provisioning, access rights, and permissions.
* Document changes, policies, and procedures in accordance with company standards.
* Maintain inventory of IT equipment and software licenses.
* Collaborate with central IT teams on infrastructure, network, and system projects.
* Monitor system performance, logs, and alerts to ensure reliability and security.
* Support infrastructure automation initiatives and participate in technical development projects.
* Participate in IT compliance, GDPR, and security policy tasks as needed.
* Ensure that employees adhere to IT usage policies and best practices.
* Assist with onboarding/offboarding processes from an IT perspective.
* Ensure a secure and updated working environment for all on-site users.
* Travel to local or regional sites if necessary (driver’s license required).
* Linux server management
* Virtual server platform management

### **Required Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in IT support, system administration, or similar role.
* Strong knowledge of **Linux/Unix** systems.
* Experience with **Bash scripting** and **Python** for automation and troubleshooting.
* Hands-on experience with **infrastructure automation tools** such as **Ansible**.
* Familiarity with **VMware** or other virtualization platforms.
* Solid understanding of networking concepts, system monitoring, and IT security.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* Strong customer service orientation with the ability to explain technical issues clearly.
* Ability to work independently and prioritize multiple tasks.
* Valid **Class B Driver’s License** required.

 **Profile**


Wide relevant technical knowledge within the IT-area


Stress tolerance and service minded


Excellent communication skills and telephone manners


Excellent organizational skills


IT Service Desk and Contact Centre experience


Excellent skills in English communication in writing and speaking


Incident Management experience – Managing incidents including business expectations

  

The position is located at Stockholm office (no remote work). Initial probationary period of 6 month.

**Last day to apply for this role is 2025-08-29**

**If you are interested, apply today as the position may be filled before the application deadline.**  

  

*If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact Nordic IT Desktop Manager* *Victor Brolin**victor.brolin@teleperformance.com*

title: Senior Build Engineer
description:
Are you the type of person who thrives on removing blockers, optimizing workflows, and solving complex software challenges? Your expertise will be key in ensuring smooth production processes, and no two days will be the same. If so, we might have the perfect role for you. We are looking for a **Senior Build Engineer** to join our team in Copenhagen or Malmö on a hybrid basis.


You'll be joining a team of passionate engineers who take ownership of their work while fostering a culture of learning and collaboration. We value ambition and humility in equal measure, and we hope you do too.

**What you will do:**

  

* Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines, virtual environments, and infrastructure (Perforce, TeamCity, etc.).
* Maintain and optimize build farms on-premise and in Azure.
* Contribute to an ambitious build farm migration project, rewriting build agents with state-of-the-art technologies.
* Write and debug automation scripts/programs in C#, PowerShell, Python, Kotlin, and more.
* Support in-house development and production teams.

**Who you are:**

* Experienced with Windows and Linux system administration.
* Hands-on with PC/Server hardware.
* Proficient in programming (C#, PowerShell, Python, Java, etc.).
* Hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or have equivalent experience.
* Skilled in troubleshooting and research.
* Adaptable and able to prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment.
* Have a strong interest in system integration and game infrastructure.
* Experienced in source control management systems as an administrator (Git, Perforce, Mercurial).

  

**Who we are:**

  

IO Interactive is an independent videogame development and publishing company with studios in Copenhagen, Malmö, Barcelona, Istanbul and Brighton. As the creative force behind some of the most talked-about multiplatform video games in the last decade, we are committed to creating unforgettable characters and experiences – all powered by our award-winning, proprietary Glacier technology.


IOI is a studio that values in-person collaboration. Being together helps us focus our collective energy on our immediate goals. For us, being both in-office as well as connected across our studios helps us integrate our teams faster, strengthen relationships, and improve knowledge-sharing. We believe that the more time we spend together, the more quality and progress we achieve for our games and players.


We know that to achieve those goals, we need courage, talented people and a great working environment – and we do our utmost to have all of that. Across our multiple studios, we’re working on several projects. Crucially though, we’re all one team. We value the work and impact that each person brings to the table and we actively encourage new ideas, whilst listening to your insights along the way.


We have a dedicated team of People Managers, who look after you as an individual and as an employee. With more than 40 nationalities, we know that everyone is different and we are proud to have a reputation for being a friendly workplace with highly-talent people.


Learn more about our Glacier engine.

title: R&D Project Manager - Digital for HVDC Transformers
description:

**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

For our research and development department at Transformers we are looking for an R&D project manager to lead development projects within condition monitoring and digitalization for HVDC Transformers. You will, together with the expert team, plan, implement and deliver digital solutions that provide novel insight into the condition of HVDC Transformers throughout their lifecycle. This role will work in close cooperation with experts in different transformer technology fields as well as with transformer design and manufacturing specialists. In addition, you will collaborate extensively with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders such as transformer factories, transformer component suppliers, software development, system integrators, product management and customers. In addition to executing R&D projects, you are also contributing to implementing developed solutions, promoting our digital portfolio, ensuring overall successful technology and providing input to future development and market needs of the HVDC transformer digital portfolio.


Working in R&D will give you the possibility to use your creativity to solve a wide spectrum of challenges. You will have exciting and varied work in front of you where you will get a broad network internally and externally.


Are you interested in project management, technology and digitalization? Please send in your application as we are interested to know more about you and what you can contribute with!


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Plan, implement and deliver new digital monitoring and digital functionality for HVDC transformers, as well as improve existing solutions.
* Lead product development efforts utilizing suitable processes and tools. Accountable for delivery on time and with quality, technical excellence, and process effectiveness of product development activities. Owning, planning, and driving the projects.
* Proactively coordinate with cross discipline team members to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules.

* Drive collaboration across a wide range of internal and external stakeholders

* Provide market needs and proposals for future developments in the digital HVDC transformer portfolio
* Developing, managing and expanding relationships with stakeholders, internal functions, and external relevant parties (e.g. customers, universities). Providing proposals for possible partnerships.

**Your background**

title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**We Are BCG X**
 We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
   

  

 Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.
   

  

 We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
   

  

* Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
* Actively involved in every part of the software development process
* Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
* Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
* Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
* Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
* A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


 What You'll Bring
   

  

**Technologies**
 Programming Languages: Python
   

  

 #BCGXjob
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Design Engineer
description:
**Role:** 
 Design Engineer
   

  

**Location:** 
 Kista, Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Contract type:** 
 full time, permanent contract
   

  

**About Marioff**
 For four decades, Marioff has been driven by the challenge of keeping people and businesses safe. Today, we are the global leader in high-pressure water mist fire protection with our HI-FOG system, setting new standards and pushing the fire protection industry forward. Rooted in Nordic innovation and delivering globally, Marioff is home to those who approach challenges with an innovative mindset, persistence, and an unwavering commitment to quality. We believe that delivering peace of mind and reliability to our customers requires empowering diverse teams to collaborate towards common success, creating a lasting impact.
   

  

 At Marioff, more than 500 motivated professionals work across the globe. As a truly global company, we value the diversity of roles and skills within our team, with colleagues from nearly 30 nationalities collaborating towards a common goal.
   

  

 With our head office in Vantaa and our factory in Kerava, Finland, we have a global reach with subsidiaries in France, Germany, Italy, North America, Spain, Sweden, the United Kingdom, Poland and China.
   

  

**Summary**
 We are currently looking for a
 **Design Engineer** 
 to strengthen our team, based in Stockholm. In this role you would be supporting the design of our fire suppression systems, performing hydraulic calculations, also participating in site surveys and communicating with our customers.
   

  

**Requirements**
 To be successful in this role, you must have:
   

  

* Higher education suitable for the task (Design, CAD, Mechanical, Building Services, Civil, Construction or Electrical Engineering)
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities needed to handle frequent discussions with the customers
* Fluent Swedish and English skills, both spoken and written
* ~2 years of work experience with AutoCAD 2D/3D (preferred) or other relevant CAD software
* Strong calculation and costing abilities
* Ability to work independently and effectively in a team, analytical skills and attention to detail


**Although Not Necessary, It Would Be a Great Advantage**
* Experience/knowledge with Revit 3D design software
* Experience with HVAC, fire protection system/sprinkler design, involvement with plumbing/piping
* Knowledge/practical experience with Hydraulic systems or Electricity/Electrical products


**Responsibilities**
 In the role of
 **Design Engineer** 
 , you focus on CAD to design and construct layout solutions of Marioff's sprinkler systems and associated detection systems. You are already involved in the sales phase together with the responsible salespeople by acting as an expert regarding design of the product. After that, you are responsible for designing solutions and layouts in AutoCAD and Revit as well as Marioff's internal tools. You are involved throughout the project until the project is completed at the customer's premises. Marioff works on several different projects in real estate and in the industrial sector.
   

  

 You will work closely with other design engineers and project managers, you would report directly to the Operations Manager, who’s based in the office in Kista. You will also work with fitters and service technicians who will work with the systems you design. The position involves some travel around Sweden.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.
   

  

* Competitive compensation
* Occupational health care service
* Marioff Employee Milestones
* An opportunity to work in a company with high technology products
* A dynamic and internationally oriented work environment


**Our commitment to you**
 We offer you a dynamic and international work environment in a company with high technology products, a strong growth strategy and people who are passionate about fire safety. At Marioff we value diversity in all its forms and we believe that it is our excellent, highly skilled people who make success, competitive excellence and innovation happen. Join us to our mission to protect people, property and business continuity!
   

  

**Apply Now!**
